3998 u8g_uint_t u8g_DrawStrFontBBX(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t dir, const char *s)
3999 {
4000  x -= u8g_GetFontBBXOffX(u8g);
4001  y += u8g_GetFontBBXOffY(u8g);
4002  return u8g_DrawStrDir(u8g, x, y, dir, s);
4003 }
4004 
4005 /* still used by picgen.c, dir argument is ignored */
4006 int8_t u8g_DrawGlyphFontBBX(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t dir, uint8_t encoding)
4007 {
4008  x -= u8g_GetFontBBXOffX(u8g);
4009  y += u8g_GetFontBBXOffY(u8g);
4010  u8g_draw_glyph(u8g, x, y, encoding);
4011  return 0;
4012 }
4013 
4014 
4015 /*========================================================================*/
4016 /* set ascent/descent for reference point calculation */
4017 
4018 void u8g_UpdateRefHeight(u8g_t *u8g)
4019 {
4020  uint16_t ls;
4021  if ( u8g->font == NULL )
4022  return;
4023  if ( u8g->font_height_mode == U8G_FONT_HEIGHT_MODE_TEXT )
4024  {
4025  u8g->font_ref_ascent = u8g_font_GetCapitalAHeight(u8g->font);
4026  u8g->font_ref_descent = u8g_font_GetLowerGDescent(u8g->font);
4027  }
4028  else if ( u8g->font_height_mode == U8G_FONT_HEIGHT_MODE_XTEXT )
4029  {
4030  u8g->font_ref_ascent = u8g_font_GetFontXAscent(u8g->font);
4031  u8g->font_ref_descent = u8g_font_GetFontXDescent(u8g->font);
4032  }
4033  else
4034  {
4035  u8g->font_ref_ascent = u8g_font_GetFontAscent(u8g->font);
4036  u8g->font_ref_descent = u8g_font_GetFontDescent(u8g->font);
4037  }
4038 
4039  ls = u8g->font_ref_ascent - u8g->font_ref_descent;
4040  if ( u8g->font_line_spacing_factor != 64 )
4041  {
4042  ls &= 255;
4043  ls *= u8g->font_line_spacing_factor;
4044  ls >>= 6;
4045  }
4046  u8g->line_spacing = ls;
4047 }
4048 
4049 void u8g_SetFontRefHeightText(u8g_t *u8g)
4050 {
4051  u8g->font_height_mode = U8G_FONT_HEIGHT_MODE_TEXT;
4052  u8g_UpdateRefHeight(u8g);
4053 }
4054 
4055 void u8g_SetFontRefHeightExtendedText(u8g_t *u8g)
4056 {
4057  u8g->font_height_mode = U8G_FONT_HEIGHT_MODE_XTEXT;
4058  u8g_UpdateRefHeight(u8g);
4059 }
4060 
4061 
4062 void u8g_SetFontRefHeightAll(u8g_t *u8g)
4063 {
4064  u8g->font_height_mode = U8G_FONT_HEIGHT_MODE_ALL;
4065  u8g_UpdateRefHeight(u8g);
4066 }
4067 
4068 /* factor = 64: linespaceing == ascent and descent */
4069 void u8g_SetFontLineSpacingFactor(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t factor)
4070 {
4071  u8g->font_line_spacing_factor = factor;
4072  u8g_UpdateRefHeight(u8g);
4073 }
4074 
4075 
4076 
4077 /*========================================================================*/
4078 /* callback procedures to correct the y position */
4079 
4080 u8g_uint_t u8g_font_calc_vref_font(u8g_t *u8g)
4081 {
4082  return 0;
4083 }
4084 
4085 void u8g_SetFontPosBaseline(u8g_t *u8g)
4086 {
4087  u8g->font_calc_vref = u8g_font_calc_vref_font;
4088 }
4089 
4090 
4091 u8g_uint_t u8g_font_calc_vref_bottom(u8g_t *u8g)
4092 {
4093  /* y += (u8g_uint_t)(u8g_int_t)(u8g->font_ref_descent); */
4094  return (u8g_uint_t)(u8g_int_t)(u8g->font_ref_descent);
4095 }
4096 
4097 void u8g_SetFontPosBottom(u8g_t *u8g)
4098 {
4099  u8g->font_calc_vref = u8g_font_calc_vref_bottom;
4100 }
4101 
4102 u8g_uint_t u8g_font_calc_vref_top(u8g_t *u8g)
4103 {
4104  u8g_uint_t tmp;
4105  /* reference pos is one pixel above the upper edge of the reference glyph */
4106 
4107  /*
4108  y += (u8g_uint_t)(u8g_int_t)(u8g->font_ref_ascent);
4109  y++;
4110  */
4111  tmp = (u8g_uint_t)(u8g_int_t)(u8g->font_ref_ascent);
4112  tmp++;
4113  return tmp;
4114 }
4115 
4116 void u8g_SetFontPosTop(u8g_t *u8g)
4117 {
4118  u8g->font_calc_vref = u8g_font_calc_vref_top;
4119 }
4120 
4121 u8g_uint_t u8g_font_calc_vref_center(u8g_t *u8g)
4122 {
4123  int8_t tmp;
4124  tmp = u8g->font_ref_ascent;
4125  tmp -= u8g->font_ref_descent;
4126  tmp /= 2;
4127  tmp += u8g->font_ref_descent;
4128  /* y += (u8g_uint_t)(u8g_int_t)(tmp); */
4129  return tmp;
4130 }
4131 
4132 void u8g_SetFontPosCenter(u8g_t *u8g)
4133 {
4134  u8g->font_calc_vref = u8g_font_calc_vref_center;
4135 }
4136 
4137 /*========================================================================*/
4138 /* string pixel width calculation */
4139 
4140 char u8g_font_get_char(const void *s)
4141 {
4142  return *(const char *)(s);
4143 }
4144 
4145 char u8g_font_get_charP(const void *s)
4146 {
4147  return u8g_pgm_read(s);
4148 }
4149 
4150 typedef char (*u8g_font_get_char_fn)(const void *s);
4151 
4152 
4153 u8g_uint_t u8g_font_calc_str_pixel_width(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_font_get_char_fn get_char )
4154 {
4155  u8g_uint_t w;
4156  uint8_t enc;
4157 
4158  /* reset the total minimal width to zero, this will be expanded during calculation */
4159  w = 0;
4160 
4161  enc = get_char(s);
4162 
4163  /* check for empty string, width is already 0 */
4164  if ( enc == '\0' )
4165  {
4166  return w;
4167  }
4168 
4169  /* get the glyph information of the first char. This must be valid, because we already checked for the empty string */
4170  /* if *s is not inside the font, then the cached parameters of the glyph are all zero */
4171  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, enc);
4172 
4173  /* strlen(s) == 1: width = width(s[0]) */
4174  /* strlen(s) == 2: width = - offx(s[0]) + deltax(s[0]) + offx(s[1]) + width(s[1]) */
4175  /* strlen(s) == 3: width = - offx(s[0]) + deltax(s[0]) + deltax(s[1]) + offx(s[2]) + width(s[2]) */
4176 
4177  /* assume that the string has size 2 or more, than start with negative offset-x */
4178  /* for string with size 1, this will be nullified after the loop */
4179  w = -u8g->glyph_x;
4180  for(;;)
4181  {
4182 
4183  /* check and stop if the end of the string is reached */
4184  s++;
4185  if ( get_char(s) == '\0' )
4186  break;
4187 
4188  /* if there are still more characters, add the delta to the next glyph */
4189  w += u8g->glyph_dx;
4190 
4191  /* store the encoding in a local variable, used also after the for(;;) loop */
4192  enc = get_char(s);
4193 
4194  /* load the next glyph information */
4195  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, enc);
4196  }
4197 
4198  /* finally calculate the width of the last char */
4199  /* here is another exception, if the last char is a black, use the dx value instead */
4200  if ( enc != ' ' )
4201  {
4202  /* if g was not updated in the for loop (strlen() == 1), then the initial offset x gets removed */
4203  w += u8g->glyph_width;
4204  w += u8g->glyph_x;
4205  }
4206  else
4207  {
4208  w += u8g->glyph_dx;
4209  }
4210 
4211 
4212  return w;
4213 }
4214 
4215 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetStrPixelWidth(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s)
4216 {
4217  return u8g_font_calc_str_pixel_width(u8g, s, u8g_font_get_char);
4218 }
4219 
4220 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetStrPixelWidthP(u8g_t *u8g, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *s)
4221 {
4222  return u8g_font_calc_str_pixel_width(u8g, (const char *)s, u8g_font_get_charP);
4223 }
4224 
4225 int8_t u8g_GetStrX(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s)
4226 {
4227  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, *s);
4228  return u8g->glyph_x;
4229 }
4230 
4231 int8_t u8g_GetStrXP(u8g_t *u8g, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *s)
4232 {
4233  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, u8g_pgm_read(s));
4234  return u8g->glyph_x;
4235 }
4236 
4237 /*========================================================================*/
4238 /* string width calculation */
4239 
4240 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetStrWidth(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s)
4241 {
4242  u8g_uint_t w;
4243  uint8_t encoding;
4244 
4245  /* reset the total width to zero, this will be expanded during calculation */
4246  w = 0;
4247 
4248  for(;;)
4249  {
4250  encoding = *s;
4251  if ( encoding == 0 )
4252  break;
4253 
4254  /* load glyph information */
4255  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, encoding);
4256  w += u8g->glyph_dx;
4257 
4258  /* goto next char */
4259  s++;
4260  }
4261 
4262  return w;
4263 }
4264 
4265 
4266 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetStrWidthP(u8g_t *u8g, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *s)
4267 {
4268  u8g_uint_t w;
4269  uint8_t encoding;
4270 
4271  /* reset the total width to zero, this will be expanded during calculation */
4272  w = 0;
4273 
4274  for(;;)
4275  {
4276  encoding = u8g_pgm_read(s);
4277  if ( encoding == 0 )
4278  break;
4279 
4280  /* load glyph information */
4281  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, encoding);
4282  w += u8g->glyph_dx;
4283 
4284  /* goto next char */
4285  s++;
4286  }
4287 
4288  return w;
4289 }
4290 
4291 
4292 /*========================================================================*/
4293 /* calculation of font/glyph/string characteristics */
4294 
4295 
4296 /*
4297  Description:
4298  Calculate parameter for the minimal bounding box on a given string
4299  Output
4300  buf->y_min extend of the lower left edge if the string below (y_min<0) or above (y_min>0) baseline (descent)
4301  buf->y_max extend of the upper left edge if the string below (y_min<0) or above (y_min>0) baseline (ascent)
4302  buf->w the width of the string
4303 */
4304 struct u8g_str_size_struct
4305 {
4306  int8_t y_min; /* descent */
4307  int8_t y_max; /* ascent */
4308  int8_t x, y; /* the reference point of the font (negated!) */
4309  u8g_uint_t w; /* width of the overall string */
4310 };
4311 typedef struct u8g_str_size_struct u8g_str_size_t;
4312 
4313 static void u8g_font_calc_str_min_box(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_str_size_t *buf)
4314 {
4315  /* u8g_glyph_t g; */
4316  int8_t tmp;
4317 
4318  /* reset the total minimal width to zero, this will be expanded during calculation */
4319  buf->w = 0;
4320 
4321  /* check for empty string, width is already 0, but also reset y_min and y_max to 0 */
4322  if ( *s == '\0' )
4323  {
4324  buf->y_min = 0;
4325  buf->y_max = 0;
4326  buf->x = 0;
4327  buf->y = 0;
4328  return;
4329  }
4330 
4331  /* reset y_min to the largest possible value. Later we search for the smallest value */
4332  /* y_min contains the position [pixel] of the lower left edge of the glyph above (y_min>0) or below (y_min<0) baseline */
4333  buf->y_min = 127;
4334  /* reset y_max to the smallest possible value. Later we search for the highest value */
4335  /* y_max contains the position [pixel] of the upper left edge of the glyph above (y_max>0) or below (y_max<0) baseline */
4336  buf->y_max = -128;
4337 
4338  /* get the glyph information of the first char. This must be valid, because we already checked for the empty string */
4339  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, *s);
4340 
4341  /* strlen(s) == 1: width = width(s[0]) */
4342  /* strlen(s) == 2: width = - offx(s[0]) + deltax(s[0]) + offx(s[1]) + width(s[1]) */
4343  /* strlen(s) == 3: width = - offx(s[0]) + deltax(s[0]) + deltax(s[1]) + offx(s[2]) + width(s[2]) */
4344 
4345  /* assume that the string has size 2 or more, than start with negative offset-x */
4346  /* for string with size 1, this will be nullified after the loop */
4347  // buf->w = - u8g_font_GetGlyphBBXOffX(u8g->font, g);
4348  buf->w = - u8g->glyph_x;
4349 
4350  /* Also copy the position of the first glyph. This is the reference point of the string (negated) */
4351  buf->x = u8g->glyph_x;
4352  buf->y = u8g->glyph_y;
4353 
4354  for(;;)
4355  {
4356 
4357  /* calculated y position of the upper left corner (y_max) and lower left corner (y_min) of the string */
4358  /* relative to the base line */
4359 
4360  tmp = u8g->glyph_y;
4361  if ( buf->y_min > tmp )
4362  buf->y_min = tmp;
4363 
4364  tmp +=u8g->glyph_height;
4365  if ( buf->y_max < tmp )
4366  buf->y_max = tmp;
4367 
4368  /* check and stop if the end of the string is reached */
4369  s++;
4370  if ( *s == '\0' )
4371  break;
4372 
4373  /* if there are still more characters, add the delta to the next glyph */
4374  buf->w += u8g->glyph_dx;
4375 
4376  /* load the next glyph information */
4377  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, *s);
4378  }
4379 
4380  /* finally calculate the width of the last char */
4381  /* if g was not updated in the for loop (strlen() == 1), then the initial offset x gets removed */
4382  buf->w += u8g->glyph_width;
4383  // buf->w += u8g_font_GetGlyphBBXOffX(u8g->font, g);
4384 
4385  buf->w += u8g->glyph_x;
4386 }
4387 
4388 /* calculate minimal box */
4389 void u8g_font_box_min(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_str_size_t *buf)
4390 {
4391  u8g_font_calc_str_min_box(u8g, s, buf);
4392 }
4393 
4394 /* calculate gA box, but do not calculate the overall width */
4395 void u8g_font_box_left_gA(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_str_size_t *buf)
4396 {
4397 
4398 }
4399 
4400 /* calculate gA box, including overall width */
4401 void u8g_font_box_all_gA(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_str_size_t *buf)
4402 {
4403 
4404 }
4405 
4406 
4407 static void u8g_font_get_str_box_fill_args(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_str_size_t *buf, u8g_uint_t *x, u8g_uint_t *y, u8g_uint_t *width, u8g_uint_t *height)
4408 {
4409  /*
4410  u8g_glyph_t g;
4411  g =
4412  */
4413  u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, *s);
4414  *x += u8g->glyph_x;
4415  *width = buf->w;
4416  *y -= buf->y_max;
4417  /* +1 because y_max is a height, this compensates the next step */
4418  //*y += 1;
4419  /* because the reference point is one below the string, this compensates the previous step */
4420  //*y -= 1;
4421  *height = buf->y_max;
4422  *height -= buf->y_min;
4423 }
4424 
4425 
4426 void u8g_GetStrMinBox(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_uint_t *x, u8g_uint_t *y, u8g_uint_t *width, u8g_uint_t *height)
4427 {
4428  u8g_str_size_t buf;
4429 
4430  if ( *s == '\0' )
4431  {
4432  *width= 0;
4433  *height = 0;
4434  return;
4435  }
4436 
4437  u8g_font_calc_str_min_box(u8g, s, &buf);
4438  u8g_font_get_str_box_fill_args(u8g, s, &buf, x, y, width, height);
4439 }
4440 
4441 
4442 void u8g_GetStrAMinBox(u8g_t *u8g, const char *s, u8g_uint_t *x, u8g_uint_t *y, u8g_uint_t *width, u8g_uint_t *height)
4443 {
4444  u8g_str_size_t buf;
4445  uint8_t cap_a;
4446 
4447  if ( *s == '\0' )
4448  {
4449  *width= 0;
4450  *height = 0;
4451  return;
4452  }
4453 
4454  cap_a = u8g_font_GetCapitalAHeight(u8g->font);
4455  u8g_font_calc_str_min_box(u8g, s, &buf);
4456  if ( buf.y_max < cap_a )
4457  buf.y_max = cap_a;
4458  u8g_font_get_str_box_fill_args(u8g, s, &buf, x, y, width, height);
4459 }
4460 
4461 void u8g_SetFont(u8g_t *u8g, const u8g_fntpgm_uint8_t *font)
4462 {
4463  if ( u8g->font != font )
4464  {
4465  u8g->font = font;
4466  u8g_UpdateRefHeight(u8g);
4467  u8g_SetFontPosBaseline(u8g);
4468  }
4469 }
4470 
4471 /*========================================================================*/
4472 /* anti aliasing fonts */
4473 
4474 int8_t u8g_draw_aa_glyph(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t encoding)
4475 {
4476  const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *data;
4477  uint8_t w, h;
4478  uint8_t i, j;
4479  u8g_uint_t ix, iy;
4480 
4481  {
4482  u8g_glyph_t g = u8g_GetGlyph(u8g, encoding);
4483  if ( g == NULL )
4484  return 0;
4485  data = u8g_font_GetGlyphDataStart(u8g->font, g);
4486  }
4487 
4488  w = u8g->glyph_width;
4489  h = u8g->glyph_height;
4490 
4491  x += u8g->glyph_x;
4492  y -= u8g->glyph_y;
4493  y--;
4494 
4495  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y-h+1, w, h) == 0 )
4496  return u8g->glyph_dx;
4497 
4498  /* now, w is reused as bytes per line */
4499  w += 3;
4500  w /= 4;
4501 
4502  iy = y;
4503  iy -= h;
4504  iy++;
4505 
4506  for( j = 0; j < h; j++ )
4507  {
4508  ix = x;
4509  for( i = 0; i < w; i++ )
4510  {
4511  u8g_Draw4TPixel(u8g, ix, iy, 0, u8g_pgm_read(data));
4512  data++;
4513  ix+=4;
4514  }
4515  iy++;
4516  }
4517  return u8g->glyph_dx;
4518 }
4519 
4520 int8_t u8g_DrawAAGlyph(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t encoding)
4521 {
4522  y += u8g->font_calc_vref(u8g);
4523  return u8g_draw_aa_glyph(u8g, x, y, encoding);
4524 }
4525 
4526 u8g_uint_t u8g_DrawAAStr(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, const char *s)
4527 {
4528  u8g_uint_t t = 0;
4529  int8_t d;
4530 
4531  if ( u8g_font_GetFormat(u8g->font) != 2 )
4532  return 0;
4533  //u8g_uint_t u8g_GetStrWidth(u8g, s);
4534  //u8g_font_GetFontAscent(u8g->font)-u8g_font_GetFontDescent(u8g->font);
4535 
4536  y += u8g->font_calc_vref(u8g);
4537 
4538  while( *s != '\0' )
4539  {
4540  d = u8g_draw_aa_glyph(u8g, x, y, *s);
4541  x += d;
4542  t += d;
4543  s++;
4544  }
4545  return t;
4546 }
4547

4559  All rights reserved.

4562  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
4563 
4564  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
4565  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
4566 
4567  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
4568  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
4569  materials provided with the distribution.
4570

4572  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
4573  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
4574  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE

4576  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
4577  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
4578  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
4579  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
4580  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,

4587 
4588 /*
4589  setup page count structure
4590  conditions: page_height <= total_height
4591 */
4592 void u8g_page_Init(u8g_page_t *p, u8g_uint_t page_height, u8g_uint_t total_height )
4593 {
4594  p->page_height = page_height;
4595  p->total_height = total_height;
4596  p->page = 0;
4597  u8g_page_First(p);
4598 }
4599 
4600 void u8g_page_First(u8g_page_t *p)
4601 {
4602  p->page_y0 = 0;
4603  p->page_y1 = p->page_height;
4604  p->page_y1--;
4605  p->page = 0;
4606 }
4607 
4608 uint8_t u8g_page_Next(u8g_page_t * p)
4609 {
4610  register u8g_uint_t y1;
4611  p->page_y0 += p->page_height;
4612  if ( p->page_y0 >= p->total_height )
4613  return 0;
4614  p->page++;
4615  y1 = p->page_y1;
4616  y1 += p->page_height;
4617  if ( y1 >= p->total_height )
4618  {
4619  y1 = p->total_height;
4620  y1--;
4621  }
4622  p->page_y1 = y1;
4623 
4624  return 1;
4625 }
4626 
4627 // =============== u8g_clip.c ================
4628 
4629 /*
4630 
4631  u8g_clip.c
4632 
4633  procedures for clipping
4634  taken over from procs in u8g_pb.c
4635 
4636  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
4637 
4638  Copyright (c) 2012, olikraus@gmail.com
4639  All rights reserved.
4640 
4641  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
4642  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
4643 
4644  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
4645  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
4646 
4647  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
4648  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
4649  materials provided with the distribution.
4650 
4651  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
4652  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
4653  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
4654  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
4655  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
4656  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
4657  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
4658  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
4659  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
4660  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
4661  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
4662  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
4663  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
4664 
4665  Notes
4666 
4667  This is one of the most critical parts of u8glib. It must be fast, but still reliable.
4668  Based on the intersection program (see tools folder), there is minimized version of
4669  the condition for the intersaction test:
4670  minimized version
4671  ---1----0 1 b1 <= a2 && b1 > b2
4672  -----1--0 1 b2 >= a1 && b1 > b2
4673  ---1-1--- 1 b1 <= a2 && b2 >= a1
4674  It includes the assumption, that a1 <= a2 is always true (correct, because
4675  a1, a2 are the page dimensions.
4676 
4677  The direct implementation of the above result is done in:
4678  uint8_t u8g_is_intersection_boolean(u8g_uint_t a0, u8g_uint_t a1, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
4679  However, this is slower than a decision tree version:
4680  static uint8_t u8g_is_intersection_decision_tree(u8g_uint_t a0, u8g_uint_t a1, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
4681  Also suprising is, that the macro implementation is slower than the inlined version.
4682 
4683  The decision tree is based on the expansion of the truth table.
4684 
4685 */
4686 
4687 
4688 #ifdef __GNUC__
4689 #define U8G_ALWAYS_INLINE __inline__ __attribute__((always_inline))
4690 #else
4691 #define U8G_ALWAYS_INLINE
4692  #endif
4693 
4694 /*
4695  intersection assumptions:
4696  a1 <= a2 is always true
4697 
4698  minimized version
4699  ---1----0 1 b1 <= a2 && b1 > b2
4700  -----1--0 1 b2 >= a1 && b1 > b2
4701  ---1-1--- 1 b1 <= a2 && b2 >= a1
4702  */
4703 
4704 #ifdef OLD_CODE_WHICH_IS_TOO_SLOW
4705 static uint8_t u8g_is_intersection_boolean(u8g_uint_t a0, u8g_uint_t a1, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
4706 {
4707  uint8_t c1, c2, c3, tmp;
4708  c1 = v0 <= a1;
4709  c2 = v1 >= a0;
4710  c3 = v0 > v1;
4711 
4712  tmp = c1;
4713  c1 &= c2;
4714  c2 &= c3;
4715  c3 &= tmp;
4716  c1 |= c2;
4717  c1 |= c3;
4718  return c1 & 1;
4719 }
4720 #endif
4721 
4722 #define U8G_IS_INTERSECTION_MACRO(a0,a1,v0,v1) ((uint8_t)( (v0) <= (a1) ) ? ( ( (v1) >= (a0) ) ? ( 1 ) : ( (v0) > (v1) ) ) : ( ( (v1) >= (a0) ) ? ( (v0) > (v1) ) : ( 0 ) ))
4723 
4724 //static uint8_t u8g_is_intersection_decision_tree(u8g_uint_t a0, u8g_uint_t a1, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1) U8G_ALWAYS_INLINE;
4725 static uint8_t U8G_ALWAYS_INLINE u8g_is_intersection_decision_tree(u8g_uint_t a0, u8g_uint_t a1, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
4726 {
4727  /* surprisingly the macro leads to larger code */
4728  /* return U8G_IS_INTERSECTION_MACRO(a0,a1,v0,v1); */
4729  if ( v0 <= a1 )
4730  {
4731  if ( v1 >= a0 )
4732  {
4733  return 1;
4734  }
4735  else
4736  {
4737  if ( v0 > v1 )
4738  {
4739  return 1;
4740  }
4741  else
4742  {
4743  return 0;
4744  }
4745  }
4746  }
4747  else
4748  {
4749  if ( v1 >= a0 )
4750  {
4751  if ( v0 > v1 )
4752  {
4753  return 1;
4754  }
4755  else
4756  {
4757  return 0;
4758  }
4759  }
4760  else
4761  {
4762  return 0;
4763  }
4764  }
4765 }
4766 
4767 
4768 uint8_t u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h)
4769 {
4770  register u8g_uint_t tmp;
4771  tmp = y;
4772  tmp += h;
4773  tmp--;
4774  if ( u8g_is_intersection_decision_tree(u8g->current_page.y0, u8g->current_page.y1, y, tmp) == 0 )
4775  return 0;
4776 
4777  tmp = x;
4778  tmp += w;
4779  tmp--;
4780  return u8g_is_intersection_decision_tree(u8g->current_page.x0, u8g->current_page.x1, x, tmp);
4781 }
4782 
4783 // ============= u8g_com_arduino_std_sw_spi.c =====================
4784 
4785 /*
4786 
4787  u8g_arduino_std_sw_spi.c
4788 
4789  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
4790 
4791  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
4792  All rights reserved.
4793 
4794  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
4795  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
4796 
4797  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
4798  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
4799 
4800  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
4801  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
4802  materials provided with the distribution.
4803 
4804  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
4805  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
4806  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
4807  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
4808  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
4809  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
4810  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
4811  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
4812  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
4813  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
4814  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
4815  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
4816  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
4817 
4818 */
4819 
4820 void u8g_arduino_sw_spi_shift_out(uint8_t dataPin, uint8_t clockPin, uint8_t val)
4821 {
4822  uint8_t i = 8;
4823  do
4824  {
4825  if ( val & 128 )
4826  digitalWrite(dataPin, HIGH);
4827  else
4828  digitalWrite(dataPin, LOW);
4829  val <<= 1;
4830  u8g_MicroDelay(); /* 23 Sep 2012 */
4831  //delay(1);
4832  digitalWrite(clockPin, HIGH);
4833  u8g_MicroDelay(); /* 23 Sep 2012 */
4834  //delay(1);
4835  digitalWrite(clockPin, LOW);
4836  u8g_MicroDelay(); /* 23 Sep 2012 */
4837  //delay(1);
4838  i--;
4839  } while( i != 0 );
4840 }
4841 
4842 uint8_t u8g_com_arduino_std_sw_spi_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
4843 {
4844  switch(msg)
4845  {
4846  case U8G_COM_MSG_INIT:
4847  u8g_com_arduino_assign_pin_output_high(u8g);
4848  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, LOW);
4849  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_MOSI, LOW);
4850  break;
4851 
4852  case U8G_COM_MSG_STOP:
4853  break;
4854 
4855  case U8G_COM_MSG_RESET:
4856  if ( u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] != U8G_PIN_NONE )
4857  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_RESET, arg_val);
4858  break;
4859 
4860  case U8G_COM_MSG_CHIP_SELECT:
4861  if ( arg_val == 0 )
4862  {
4863  /* disable */
4864  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, HIGH);
4865  }
4866  else
4867  {
4868  /* enable */
4869  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, LOW);
4870  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, LOW);
4871  }
4872  break;
4873 
4874  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_BYTE:
4875  u8g_arduino_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_MOSI], u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SCK], arg_val);
4876  break;
4877 
4878  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ:
4879  {
4880  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
4881  while( arg_val > 0 )
4882  {
4883  u8g_arduino_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_MOSI], u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SCK], *ptr++);
4884  arg_val--;
4885  }
4886  }
4887  break;
4888 
4889  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ_P:
4890  {
4891  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
4892  while( arg_val > 0 )
4893  {
4894  u8g_arduino_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_MOSI], u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SCK], u8g_pgm_read(ptr));
4895  ptr++;
4896  arg_val--;
4897  }
4898  }
4899  break;
4900 
4901  case U8G_COM_MSG_ADDRESS: /* define cmd (arg_val = 0) or data mode (arg_val = 1) */
4902  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_A0, arg_val);
4903  break;
4904  }
4905  return 1;
4906 }
4907 
4908 
4909 // ======== u8g_com_atmega_st7920_spi.c ==============
4910 
4911 /*
4912 
4913  u8g_com_atmega_st7920_spi.c
4914 
4915  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
4916 
4917  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
4918  All rights reserved.
4919 
4920  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
4921  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
4922 
4923  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
4924  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
4925 
4926  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
4927  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
4928  materials provided with the distribution.
4929 
4930  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
4931  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
4932  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
4933  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
4934  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
4935  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
4936  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
4937  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
4938  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
4939  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
4940  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
4941  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
4942  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
4943 
4944  A special SPI interface for ST7920 controller
4945 
4946 */
4947 
4948 #if defined(__AVR__)
4949 
4950 static void u8g_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t val) U8G_NOINLINE;
4951 static void u8g_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t val)
4952 {
4953  uint8_t i = 8;
4954  do
4955  {
4956  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_MOSI, val & 128 );
4957  val <<= 1;
4958  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, 1 );
4959  u8g_MicroDelay(); /* 15 Aug 2012: added for high speed uC */
4960  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, 0 );
4961  u8g_MicroDelay(); /* 15 Aug 2012: added for high speed uC */
4962  i--;
4963  } while( i != 0 );
4964 }
4965 
4966 static void u8g_com_atmega_st7920_write_byte(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t rs, uint8_t val) U8G_NOINLINE;
4967 static void u8g_com_atmega_st7920_write_byte(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t rs, uint8_t val)
4968 {
4969  uint8_t i;
4970 
4971  if ( rs == 0 )
4972  {
4973  /* command */
4974  u8g_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g, 0x0f8);
4975  }
4976  else if ( rs == 1 )
4977  {
4978  /* data */
4979  u8g_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g, 0x0fa);
4980  }
4981 
4982  u8g_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g, val & 0x0f0);
4983  u8g_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g, val << 4);
4984 
4985  for( i = 0; i < 4; i++ )
4986  u8g_10MicroDelay();
4987 }
4988 
4989 
4990 uint8_t u8g_com_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
4991 {
4992  switch(msg)
4993  {
4994  case U8G_COM_MSG_INIT:
4995  u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK);
4996  u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_MOSI);
4997  /* u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_A0); */
4998  u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_CS);
4999  u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_RESET);
5000 
5001  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, 0 );
5002  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_MOSI, 0 );
5003  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, 0 );
5004  /* u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_A0, 0); */
5005 
5006  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 0; /* inital RS state: command mode */
5007  break;
5008 
5009  case U8G_COM_MSG_STOP:
5010  break;
5011 
5012  case U8G_COM_MSG_RESET:
5013  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_RESET, arg_val);
5014  break;
5015 
5016  case U8G_COM_MSG_ADDRESS: /* define cmd (arg_val = 0) or data mode (arg_val = 1) */
5017  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = arg_val;
5018  break;
5019 
5020  case U8G_COM_MSG_CHIP_SELECT:
5021  if ( arg_val == 0 )
5022  {
5023  /* disable, note: the st7920 has an active high chip select */
5024  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, 0);
5025  }
5026  else
5027  {
5028  /* u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, 0 ); */
5029  /* enable */
5030  u8g_SetPILevel(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, 1); /* CS = 1 (high active) */
5031  }
5032  break;
5033 
5034 
5035  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_BYTE:
5036  u8g_com_atmega_st7920_write_byte(u8g, u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE], arg_val);
5037  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 2;
5038  break;
5039 
5040  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ:
5041  {
5042  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
5043  while( arg_val > 0 )
5044  {
5045  u8g_com_atmega_st7920_write_byte(u8g, u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE], *ptr++);
5046  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 2;
5047  arg_val--;
5048  }
5049  }
5050  break;
5051 
5052  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ_P:
5053  {
5054  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
5055  while( arg_val > 0 )
5056  {
5057  u8g_com_atmega_st7920_write_byte(u8g, u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE], u8g_pgm_read(ptr));
5058  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 2;
5059  ptr++;
5060  arg_val--;
5061  }
5062  }
5063  break;
5064  }
5065  return 1;
5066 }
5067 
5068 #else
5069 
5070 
5071 uint8_t u8g_com_atmega_st7920_sw_spi_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
5072 {
5073  return 1;
5074 }
5075 
5076 
5077 #endif
5078 
5079 // ================ u8g_butmap.c ===============
5080 
5081 /*
5082 
5083  u8g_bitmap.c
5084 
5085  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
5086 
5087  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
5088  All rights reserved.
5089 
5090  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
5091  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
5092 
5093  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
5094  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
5095 
5096  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
5097  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
5098  materials provided with the distribution.
5099 
5100  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
5101  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
5102  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
5103  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
5104  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
5105  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
5106  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
5107  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
5108  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
5109  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
5110  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
5111  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
5112  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
5113 
5114 
5115 */
5116 
5117 
5118 void u8g_DrawHBitmap(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t cnt, const uint8_t *bitmap)
5119 {
5120  while( cnt > 0 )
5121  {
5122  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 0, *bitmap);
5123  bitmap++;
5124  cnt--;
5125  x+=8;
5126  }
5127 }
5128 
5129 void u8g_DrawBitmap(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t cnt, u8g_uint_t h, const uint8_t *bitmap)
5130 {
5131  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, cnt*8, h) == 0 )
5132  return;
5133  while( h > 0 )
5134  {
5135  u8g_DrawHBitmap(u8g, x, y, cnt, bitmap);
5136  bitmap += cnt;
5137  y++;
5138  h--;
5139  }
5140 }
5141 
5142 
5143 void u8g_DrawHBitmapP(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t cnt, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *bitmap)
5144 {
5145  while( cnt > 0 )
5146  {
5147  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 0, u8g_pgm_read(bitmap));
5148  bitmap++;
5149  cnt--;
5150  x+=8;
5151  }
5152 }
5153 
5154 void u8g_DrawBitmapP(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t cnt, u8g_uint_t h, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *bitmap)
5155 {
5156  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, cnt*8, h) == 0 )
5157  return;
5158  while( h > 0 )
5159  {
5160  u8g_DrawHBitmapP(u8g, x, y, cnt, bitmap);
5161  bitmap += cnt;
5162  y++;
5163  h--;
5164  }
5165 }
5166 
5167 /*=========================================================================*/
5168 
5169 static void u8g_DrawHXBM(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, const uint8_t *bitmap)
5170 {
5171  uint8_t d;
5172  x+=7;
5173  while( w >= 8 )
5174  {
5175  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 2, *bitmap);
5176  bitmap++;
5177  w-= 8;
5178  x+=8;
5179  }
5180  if ( w > 0 )
5181  {
5182  d = *bitmap;
5183  x -= 7;
5184  do
5185  {
5186  if ( d & 1 )
5187  u8g_DrawPixel(u8g, x, y);
5188  x++;
5189  w--;
5190  d >>= 1;
5191  } while ( w > 0 );
5192  }
5193 }
5194 
5195 void u8g_DrawXBM(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h, const uint8_t *bitmap)
5196 {
5197  u8g_uint_t b;
5198  b = w;
5199  b += 7;
5200  b >>= 3;
5201 
5202  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, h) == 0 )
5203  return;
5204 
5205  while( h > 0 )
5206  {
5207  u8g_DrawHXBM(u8g, x, y, w, bitmap);
5208  bitmap += b;
5209  y++;
5210  h--;
5211  }
5212 }
5213 
5214 static void u8g_DrawHXBMP(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *bitmap)
5215 {
5216  uint8_t d;
5217  x+=7;
5218  while( w >= 8 )
5219  {
5220  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 2, u8g_pgm_read(bitmap));
5221  bitmap++;
5222  w-= 8;
5223  x+=8;
5224  }
5225  if ( w > 0 )
5226  {
5227  d = u8g_pgm_read(bitmap);
5228  x -= 7;
5229  do
5230  {
5231  if ( d & 1 )
5232  u8g_DrawPixel(u8g, x, y);
5233  x++;
5234  w--;
5235  d >>= 1;
5236  } while ( w > 0 );
5237  }
5238 }
5239 
5240 void u8g_DrawXBMP(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h, const u8g_pgm_uint8_t *bitmap)
5241 {
5242  u8g_uint_t b;
5243  b = w;
5244  b += 7;
5245  b >>= 3;
5246 
5247  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, h) == 0 )
5248  return;
5249  while( h > 0 )
5250  {
5251  u8g_DrawHXBMP(u8g, x, y, w, bitmap);
5252  bitmap += b;
5253  y++;
5254  h--;
5255  }
5256 }
5257

5275  of conditions and the following disclaimer.

5278  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
5279  materials provided with the distribution.

5282  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
5283  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
5284  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
5285  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
5286  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
5287  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
5288  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
5289  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER

5297 
5298 uint8_t u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg)
5299 {
5300  return dev->dev_fn(u8g, dev, msg, arg);
5301 }
5302 
5303 /*====================================================================*/
5304 
5305 uint8_t u8g_InitLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5306 {
5307  uint8_t r;
5308  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_ENV);
5309  r = u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_INIT, NULL);
5310  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_U8G);
5311  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_ENV);
5312  return r;
5313 }
5314 
5315 void u8g_FirstPageLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5316 {
5317  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_ENV);
5318  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_U8G);
5319  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_PAGE_FIRST, NULL);
5320  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_PAGE_BOX, &(u8g->current_page));
5321  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_ENV);
5322 }
5323 
5324 uint8_t u8g_NextPageLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5325 {
5326  uint8_t r;
5327  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_ENV);
5328  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_U8G);
5329  r = u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_PAGE_NEXT, NULL);
5330  if ( r != 0 )
5331  {
5332  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_PAGE_BOX, &(u8g->current_page));
5333  }
5334  u8g->state_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_ENV);
5335  return r;
5336 }
5337 
5338 uint8_t u8g_SetContrastLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t contrast)
5339 {
5340  return u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_CONTRAST, &contrast);
5341 }
5342 
5343 void u8g_DrawPixelLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y)
5344 {
5345  u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg = &(u8g->arg_pixel);
5346  arg->x = x;
5347  arg->y = y;
5348  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_PIXEL, arg);
5349 }
5350 
5351 void u8g_Draw8PixelLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t dir, uint8_t pixel)
5352 {
5353  u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg = &(u8g->arg_pixel);
5354  arg->x = x;
5355  arg->y = y;
5356  arg->dir = dir;
5357  arg->pixel = pixel;
5358  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_8PIXEL, arg);
5359 }
5360 
5361 void u8g_Draw4TPixelLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t dir, uint8_t pixel)
5362 {
5363  u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg = &(u8g->arg_pixel);
5364  arg->x = x;
5365  arg->y = y;
5366  arg->dir = dir;
5367  arg->pixel = pixel;
5368  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_4TPIXEL, arg);
5369 }
5370 
5371 
5372 #ifdef U8G_DEV_MSG_IS_BBX_INTERSECTION
5373 uint8_t u8g_IsBBXIntersectionLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h)
5374 {
5375  return u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_IS_BBX_INTERSECTION, &arg);
5376 }
5377 #endif
5378 
5379 
5380 
5381 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetWidthLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5382 {
5383  u8g_uint_t r;
5384  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_WIDTH, &r);
5385  return r;
5386 }
5387 
5388 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetHeightLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5389 {
5390  u8g_uint_t r;
5391  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_HEIGHT, &r);
5392  return r;
5393 }
5394 
5395 u8g_uint_t u8g_GetModeLL(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5396 {
5397  return u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_MODE, NULL);
5398 }
5399 
5400 
5401 
5402 /*====================================================================*/
5403 
5404 void u8g_UpdateDimension(u8g_t *u8g)
5405 {
5406  u8g->width = u8g_GetWidthLL(u8g, u8g->dev);
5407  u8g->height = u8g_GetHeightLL(u8g, u8g->dev);
5408  u8g->mode = u8g_GetModeLL(u8g, u8g->dev);
5409  /* 9 Dec 2012: u8g_scale.c requires update of current page */
5410  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, u8g->dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_PAGE_BOX, &(u8g->current_page));
5411 }
5412 
5413 static void u8g_init_data(u8g_t *u8g)
5414 {
5415  u8g->font = NULL;
5416  u8g->cursor_font = NULL;
5417  u8g->cursor_bg_color = 0;
5418  u8g->cursor_fg_color = 1;
5419  u8g->cursor_encoding = 34;
5420  u8g->cursor_fn = (u8g_draw_cursor_fn)0;
5421 
5422 #if defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST)
5423  {
5424  uint8_t i;
5425  for( i = 0; i < U8G_PIN_LIST_LEN; i++ )
5426  u8g->pin_list[i] = U8G_PIN_NONE;
5427  }
5428 #endif
5429 
5430  u8g_SetColorIndex(u8g, 1);
5431 
5432  u8g_SetFontPosBaseline(u8g);
5433 
5434  u8g->font_height_mode = U8G_FONT_HEIGHT_MODE_XTEXT;
5435  u8g->font_ref_ascent = 0;
5436  u8g->font_ref_descent = 0;
5437  u8g->font_line_spacing_factor = 64; /* 64 = 1.0, 77 = 1.2 line spacing factor */
5438  u8g->line_spacing = 0;
5439 
5440  u8g->state_cb = u8g_state_dummy_cb;
5441 
5442 }
5443 
5444 uint8_t u8g_Begin(u8g_t *u8g)
5445 {
5446  /* call and init low level driver and com device */
5447  if ( u8g_InitLL(u8g, u8g->dev) == 0 )
5448  return 0;
5449  /* fetch width and height from the low level */
5450  u8g_UpdateDimension(u8g);
5451  return 1;
5452 }
5453 
5454 uint8_t u8g_Init(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5455 {
5456  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5457  u8g->dev = dev;
5458 
5459  /* On the Arduino Environment this will lead to two calls to u8g_Begin(), the following line will be called first (by U8glib constructors) */
5460  /* if - in future releases - this is removed, then still call u8g_UpdateDimension() */
5461  /* if Arduino call u8g_UpdateDimension else u8g_Begin */
5462  /* issue 146 */
5463  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5464 }
5465 
5466 /* special init for pure ARM systems */
5467 uint8_t u8g_InitComFn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, u8g_com_fnptr com_fn)
5468 {
5469  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5470 
5471 #if defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST)
5472  {
5473  uint8_t i;
5474  for( i = 0; i < U8G_PIN_LIST_LEN; i++ )
5475  u8g->pin_list[i] = U8G_PIN_DUMMY;
5476  }
5477 #endif
5478 
5479  u8g->dev = dev;
5480 
5481  /* replace the device procedure with a custom communication procedure */
5482  u8g->dev->com_fn = com_fn;
5483 
5484  /* On the Arduino Environment this will lead to two calls to u8g_Begin(), the following line will be called first (by U8glib constructors) */
5485  /* if - in future releases - this is removed, then still call u8g_UpdateDimension() */
5486  /* if Arduino call u8g_UpdateDimension else u8g_Begin */
5487  /* issue 146 */
5488  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5489 }
5490 
5491 
5492 #if defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST)
5493 uint8_t u8g_InitSPI(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t sck, uint8_t mosi, uint8_t cs, uint8_t a0, uint8_t reset)
5494 {
5495 
5496  /* fill data structure with some suitable values */
5497  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5498  u8g->dev = dev;
5499 
5500  /* assign user pins */
5501  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SCK] = sck;
5502  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_MOSI] = mosi;
5503  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS] = cs;
5504  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0] = a0;
5505  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] = reset;
5506 
5507  /* On the Arduino Environment this will lead to two calls to u8g_Begin(), the following line will be called first (by U8glib constructors) */
5508  /* if - in future releases - this is removed, then still call u8g_UpdateDimension() */
5509  /* if Arduino call u8g_UpdateDimension else u8g_Begin */
5510  /* issue 146 */
5511  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5512 }
5513 
5514 uint8_t u8g_InitHWSPI(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t cs, uint8_t a0, uint8_t reset)
5515 {
5516  /* fill data structure with some suitable values */
5517  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5518  u8g->dev = dev;
5519 
5520 
5521  /* assign user pins */
5522  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS] = cs;
5523  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0] = a0;
5524  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] = reset;
5525 
5526  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5527 }
5528

5530 {

5538 }

5541 uint8_t u8g_Init8BitFixedPort(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t en, uint8_t cs, uint8_t di, uint8_t rw, uint8_t reset)
5542 {
5543 
5544  /* fill data structure with some suitable values */
5545  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5546  u8g->dev = dev;
5547 
5548  /* assign user pins */
5549 
5550  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_EN] = en;
5551  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS] = cs;
5552  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_DI] = di;
5553  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RW] = rw;
5554  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] = reset;
5555 
5556  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5557 }
5558 
5559 uint8_t u8g_Init8Bit(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t d0, uint8_t d1, uint8_t d2, uint8_t d3, uint8_t d4, uint8_t d5, uint8_t d6, uint8_t d7,
5560  uint8_t en, uint8_t cs1, uint8_t cs2, uint8_t di, uint8_t rw, uint8_t reset)
5561 {
5562 
5563  /* fill data structure with some suitable values */
5564  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5565  u8g->dev = dev;
5566 
5567  /* assign user pins */
5568 
5569  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D0] = d0;
5570  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D1] = d1;
5571  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D2] = d2;
5572  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D3] = d3;
5573  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D4] = d4;
5574  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D5] = d5;
5575  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D6] = d6;
5576  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D7] = d7;
5577 
5578  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_EN] = en;
5579  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS1] = cs1;
5580  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS2] = cs2;
5581  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_DI] = di;
5582  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RW] = rw;
5583  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] = reset;
5584 
5585  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5586 }
5587 
5588 /*
5589 
5590  PIN_D0 8
5591  PIN_D1 9
5592  PIN_D2 10
5593  PIN_D3 11
5594  PIN_D4 4
5595  PIN_D5 5
5596  PIN_D6 6
5597  PIN_D7 7
5598 
5599  PIN_CS 14
5600  PIN_A0 15
5601  PIN_RESET 16
5602  PIN_WR 17
5603  PIN_RD 18
5604 
5605  u8g_InitRW8Bit(u8g, dev, d0, d1, d2, d3, d4, d5, d6, d7, cs, a0, wr, rd, reset)
5606  u8g_InitRW8Bit(u8g, dev, 8, 9, 10, 11, 4, 5, 6, 7, 14, 15, 17, 18, 16)
5607 
5608 */
5609 
5610 uint8_t u8g_InitRW8Bit(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t d0, uint8_t d1, uint8_t d2, uint8_t d3, uint8_t d4, uint8_t d5, uint8_t d6, uint8_t d7,
5611  uint8_t cs, uint8_t a0, uint8_t wr, uint8_t rd, uint8_t reset)
5612 {
5613 
5614  /* fill data structure with some suitable values */
5615  u8g_init_data(u8g);
5616  u8g->dev = dev;
5617 
5618  /* assign user pins */
5619 
5620  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D0] = d0;
5621  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D1] = d1;
5622  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D2] = d2;
5623  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D3] = d3;
5624  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D4] = d4;
5625  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D5] = d5;
5626  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D6] = d6;
5627  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_D7] = d7;
5628 
5629  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS] = cs;
5630  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0] = a0;
5631  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_WR] = wr;
5632  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RD] = rd;
5633  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] = reset;
5634 
5635  return u8g_Begin(u8g);
5636 }
5637 #endif /* defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST) */
5638 
5639 void u8g_FirstPage(u8g_t *u8g)
5640 {
5641  u8g_FirstPageLL(u8g, u8g->dev);
5642 }
5643 
5644 uint8_t u8g_NextPage(u8g_t *u8g)
5645 {
5646  if ( u8g->cursor_fn != (u8g_draw_cursor_fn)0 )
5647  {
5648  u8g->cursor_fn(u8g);
5649  }
5650  return u8g_NextPageLL(u8g, u8g->dev);
5651 }
5652 
5653 uint8_t u8g_SetContrast(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t contrast)
5654 {
5655  return u8g_SetContrastLL(u8g, u8g->dev, contrast);
5656 }
5657

5659 {
5660  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, u8g->dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_SLEEP_ON, NULL);
5661 }
5662 
5663 void u8g_SleepOff(u8g_t *u8g)
5664 {
5665  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, u8g->dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_SLEEP_OFF, NULL);
5666 }
