5683 
5684 
5685 /* u8g_IsBBXIntersection() has been moved to u8g_clip.c */
5686 #ifdef OBSOLETE_CODE
5687 uint8_t u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h)
5688 {
5689  /* new code */
5690  u8g_dev_arg_bbx_t arg;
5691  arg.x = x;
5692  arg.y = y;
5693  arg.w = w;
5694  arg.h = h;
5695  return u8g_is_box_bbx_intersection(&(u8g->current_page), &arg);
5696 
5697  /* old code */
5698  //return u8g_IsBBXIntersectionLL(u8g, u8g->dev, x, y, w, h);
5699 }
5700 #endif
5701 
5702 /*
5703  idx: index for the palette entry (0..255)
5704  r: value for red (0..255)
5705  g: value for green (0..255)
5706  b: value for blue (0..255)
5707 */
5708 void u8g_SetColorEntry(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t idx, uint8_t r, uint8_t g, uint8_t b)
5709 {
5710  u8g_dev_arg_irgb_t irgb;
5711  irgb.idx = idx;
5712  irgb.r = r;
5713  irgb.g = g;
5714  irgb.b = b;
5715  u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g, u8g->dev, U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_COLOR_ENTRY, &irgb);
5716 }
5717 
5718 void u8g_SetColorIndex(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t idx)
5719 {
5720  u8g->arg_pixel.color = idx;
5721  /*u8g->color_index = idx; */ /* must be removed */
5722 }
5723 
5724 void u8g_SetHiColor(u8g_t *u8g, uint16_t rgb)
5725 {
5726  u8g->arg_pixel.color = rgb&255;
5727  u8g->arg_pixel.hi_color = rgb>>8;
5728  /*u8g->color_index = idx; */ /* must be removed */
5729 }
5730 
5731 void u8g_SetHiColorByRGB(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t r, uint8_t g, uint8_t b)
5732 {
5733 
5734  r &= ~7;
5735  g >>= 2;
5736  b >>= 3;
5737  u8g->arg_pixel.color = b;
5738  u8g->arg_pixel.color |= (g & 7) << 5;
5739  u8g->arg_pixel.hi_color = r;
5740  u8g->arg_pixel.hi_color |= (g>>3) & 7;
5741 
5742  //u8g_SetHiColor(u8g, U8G_GET_HICOLOR_BY_RGB(r,g,b));
5743 }
5744 
5745 void u8g_SetRGB(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t r, uint8_t g, uint8_t b)
5746 {
5747  if ( u8g->mode == U8G_MODE_R3G3B2 )
5748  {
5749  r &= 0x0e0;
5750  g &= 0x0e0;
5751  g >>= 3;
5752  b >>= 6;
5753  u8g->arg_pixel.color = r | g | b;
5754  }
5755  else if ( u8g->mode == U8G_MODE_HICOLOR )
5756  {
5757  u8g_SetHiColorByRGB(u8g, r,g,b);
5758  }
5759  else
5760  {
5761  u8g->arg_pixel.color = r;
5762  u8g->arg_pixel.hi_color = g;
5763  u8g->arg_pixel.blue = b;
5764  }
5765 }
5766 
5767 
5768 uint8_t u8g_GetColorIndex(u8g_t *u8g)
5769 {
5770  return u8g->arg_pixel.color;
5771 }
5772 
5773 uint8_t u8g_GetDefaultForegroundColor(u8g_t *u8g)
5774 {
5775  uint8_t mode;
5776  mode = u8g_GetMode(u8g);
5777  if ( mode == U8G_MODE_R3G3B2 )
5778  return 255; /* white */
5779  else if ( u8g_GetMode(u8g) == U8G_MODE_GRAY2BIT )
5780  return 3; /* max intensity */
5781  else /* if ( u8g.getMode() == U8G_MODE_BW ) */
5782  return 1; /* pixel on */
5783  return 1;
5784 }
5785 
5786 void u8g_SetDefaultForegroundColor(u8g_t *u8g)
5787 {
5788  if ( u8g->mode == U8G_MODE_HICOLOR )
5789  {
5790  u8g->arg_pixel.color = 0x0ff;
5791  u8g->arg_pixel.hi_color = 0x0ff;
5792  }
5793  else
5794  {
5795  u8g_SetColorIndex(u8g, u8g_GetDefaultForegroundColor(u8g));
5796  }
5797 }
5798 
5799 uint8_t u8g_GetDefaultBackgroundColor(u8g_t *u8g)
5800 {
5801  return 0;
5802 }
5803 
5804 void u8g_SetDefaultBackgroundColor(u8g_t *u8g)
5805 {
5806  u8g_SetColorIndex(u8g, u8g_GetDefaultBackgroundColor(u8g)); /* pixel on / black */
5807 }
5808 
5809 uint8_t u8g_GetDefaultMidColor(u8g_t *u8g)
5810 {
5811  uint8_t mode;
5812  mode = u8g_GetMode(u8g);
5813  if ( mode == U8G_MODE_R3G3B2 )
5814  return 0x06d; /* gray: 01101101 */
5815  else if ( u8g_GetMode(u8g) == U8G_MODE_GRAY2BIT )
5816  return 1; /* low mid intensity */
5817  else /* if ( u8g.getMode() == U8G_MODE_BW ) */
5818  return 1; /* pixel on */
5819  return 1; /* default */
5820 }
5821 
5822 void u8g_SetDefaultMidColor(u8g_t *u8g)
5823 {
5824  u8g_SetColorIndex(u8g, u8g_GetDefaultMidColor(u8g));
5825 }
5826 
5827 // ============== u8g_com_api.c ==================
5828 /*
5829 
5830  u8g_com_api.c
5831 
5832  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
5833 
5834  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
5835  All rights reserved.
5836 
5837  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
5838  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
5839 
5840  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
5841  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
5842 
5843  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
5844  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
5845  materials provided with the distribution.
5846 
5847  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
5848  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
5849  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
5850  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
5851  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
5852  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
5853  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
5854  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
5855  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
5856  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
5857  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
5858  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
5859  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
5860 
5861 
5862 */
5863 
5864 
5865 uint8_t u8g_InitCom(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t clk_cycle_time)
5866 {
5867  return dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_INIT, clk_cycle_time, NULL);
5868 }
5869 
5870 void u8g_StopCom(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5871 {
5872  dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_STOP, 0, NULL);
5873 }
5874 
5875 /* cs contains the chip number, which should be enabled */
5876 void u8g_SetChipSelect(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t cs)
5877 {
5878  dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_CHIP_SELECT, cs, NULL);
5879 }
5880 
5881 void u8g_SetResetLow(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5882 {
5883  dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_RESET, 0, NULL);
5884 }
5885 
5886 void u8g_SetResetHigh(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
5887 {
5888  dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_RESET, 1, NULL);
5889 }
5890 
5891 
5892 void u8g_SetAddress(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t address)
5893 {
5894  dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_ADDRESS, address, NULL);
5895 }
5896 
5897 uint8_t u8g_WriteByte(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t val)
5898 {
5899  return dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_BYTE, val, NULL);
5900 }
5901 
5902 uint8_t u8g_WriteSequence(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t cnt, uint8_t *seq)
5903 {
5904  return dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ, cnt, seq);
5905 }
5906 
5907 uint8_t u8g_WriteSequenceP(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t cnt, const uint8_t *seq)
5908 {
5909  return dev->com_fn(u8g, U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ_P, cnt, (void *)seq);
5910 }
5911 
5912 /*
5913  sequence := { direct_value | escape_sequence }
5914  direct_value := 0..254
5915  escape_sequence := value_255 | sequence_end | delay | adr | cs | not_used
5916  value_255 := 255 255
5917  sequence_end = 255 254
5918  delay := 255 0..127
5919  adr := 255 0x0e0 .. 0x0ef
5920  cs := 255 0x0d0 .. 0x0df
5921  not_used := 255 101..254
5922 
5923 #define U8G_ESC_DLY(x) 255, ((x) & 0x7f)
5924 #define U8G_ESC_CS(x) 255, (0xd0 | ((x)&0x0f))
5925 #define U8G_ESC_ADR(x) 255, (0xe0 | ((x)&0x0f))
5926 #define U8G_ESC_VCC(x) 255, (0xbe | ((x)&0x01))
5927 #define U8G_ESC_END 255, 254
5928 #define U8G_ESC_255 255, 255
5929 #define U8G_ESC_RST(x) 255, (0xc0 | ((x)&0x0f))
5930 
5931 */
5932 uint8_t u8g_WriteEscSeqP(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, const uint8_t *esc_seq)
5933 {
5934  uint8_t is_escape = 0;
5935  uint8_t value;
5936  for(;;)
5937  {
5938  value = u8g_pgm_read(esc_seq);
5939  if ( is_escape == 0 )
5940  {
5941  if ( value != 255 )
5942  {
5943  if ( u8g_WriteByte(u8g, dev, value) == 0 )
5944  return 0;
5945  }
5946  else
5947  {
5948  is_escape = 1;
5949  }
5950  }
5951  else
5952  {
5953  if ( value == 255 )
5954  {
5955  if ( u8g_WriteByte(u8g, dev, value) == 0 )
5956  return 0;
5957  }
5958  else if ( value == 254 )
5959  {
5960  break;
5961  }
5962  else if ( value >= 0x0f0 )
5963  {
5964  /* not yet used, do nothing */
5965  }
5966  else if ( value >= 0xe0 )
5967  {
5968  u8g_SetAddress(u8g, dev, value & 0x0f);
5969  }
5970  else if ( value >= 0xd0 )
5971  {
5972  u8g_SetChipSelect(u8g, dev, value & 0x0f);
5973  }
5974  else if ( value >= 0xc0 )
5975  {
5976  u8g_SetResetLow(u8g, dev);
5977  value &= 0x0f;
5978  value <<= 4;
5979  value+=2;
5980  u8g_Delay(value);
5981  u8g_SetResetHigh(u8g, dev);
5982  u8g_Delay(value);
5983  }
5984  else if ( value >= 0xbe )
5985  {
5986  /* not yet implemented */
5987  /* u8g_SetVCC(u8g, dev, value & 0x01); */
5988  }
5989  else if ( value <= 127 )
5990  {
5991  u8g_Delay(value);
5992  }
5993  is_escape = 0;
5994  }
5995  esc_seq++;
5996  }
5997  return 1;
5998 }
5999 
6000 
6001 // ============ u8g_delay.c ===========
6002 /*
6003 
6004  u8g_delay.c
6005 
6006  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
6007 
6008  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
6009  All rights reserved.
6010 
6011  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
6012  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
6013 
6014  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
6015  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
6016 
6017  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
6018  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
6019  materials provided with the distribution.
6020 
6021  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
6022  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
6023  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
6024  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
6025  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
6026  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
6027  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
6028  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
6029  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
6030  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
6031  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
6032  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
6033  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
6034 
6035 
6036  void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val) Delay by "val" milliseconds
6037  void u8g_MicroDelay(void) Delay be one microsecond
6038  void u8g_10MicroDelay(void) Delay by 10 microseconds
6039 
6040 
6041 */
6042 
6043 
6044 
6045 /*==== Part 1: Derive suitable delay procedure ====*/
6046 
6047 #if defined(ARDUINO)
6048 
6049 # if defined(__AVR__)
6050 # define USE_AVR_DELAY
6051 # elif defined(__PIC32MX)
6052 # define USE_PIC32_DELAY
6053 # elif defined(__arm__) /* Arduino Due */
6054 # define USE_ARDUINO_DELAY
6055 # else
6056 # define USE_ARDUINO_DELAY
6057 # endif
6058 #elif defined(__AVR__)
6059 # define USE_AVR_DELAY
6060 #elif defined(__18CXX)
6061 # define USE_PIC18_DELAY
6062 #elif defined(__arm__)
6063 /* do not define anything, all procedures are expected to be defined outside u8glib */
6064 
6065 /*
6066 void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val);
6067 void u8g_MicroDelay(void);
6068 void u8g_10MicroDelay(void);
6069 */
6070 
6071 #else
6072 # define USE_DUMMY_DELAY
6073 #endif
6074 
6075 
6076 
6077 /*==== Part 2: Definition of the delay procedures ====*/
6078 
6079 /*== AVR Delay ==*/
6080 
6081 #if defined(USE_AVR_DELAY)
6082 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
6083 #include <avr/io.h>
6084 #include <util/delay.h>
6085 
6086 /*
6087  Delay by the provided number of milliseconds.
6088  Thus, a 16 bit value will allow a delay of 0..65 seconds
6089  Makes use of the _delay_loop_2
6090 
6091  _delay_loop_2 will do a delay of n * 4 prozessor cycles.
6092  with f = F_CPU cycles per second,
6093  n = f / (1000 * 4 )
6094  with f = 16000000 the result is 4000
6095  with f = 1000000 the result is 250
6096 
6097  the millisec loop, gcc requires the following overhead:
6098  - movev 1
6099  - subwi 2x2
6100  - bne i 2
6101  ==> 7 cycles
6102  ==> must be devided by 4, rounded up 7/4 = 2
6103 */
6104 void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val)
6105 {
6106  /* old version did a call to the arduino lib: delay(val); */
6107  while( val != 0 )
6108  {
6109  _delay_loop_2( (F_CPU / 4000 ) -2);
6110  val--;
6111  }
6112 }
6113 
6114 /* delay by one micro second */
6115 void u8g_MicroDelay(void)
6116 {
6117 #if (F_CPU / 4000000 ) > 0
6118  _delay_loop_2( (F_CPU / 4000000 ) );
6119 #endif
6120 }
6121 
6122 /* delay by 10 micro seconds */
6123 void u8g_10MicroDelay(void)
6124 {
6125 #if (F_CPU / 400000 ) > 0
6126  _delay_loop_2( (F_CPU / 400000 ) );
6127 #endif
6128 }
6129 
6130 #endif
6131 
6132 
6133 /*== Delay for PIC18 (not tested) ==*/
6134 
6135 #if defined(USE_PIC18_DELAY)
6136 #include <delays.h>
6137 #define GetSystemClock() (64000000ul) // Hz
6138 #define GetInstructionClock() (GetSystemClock()/4)
6139 
6140 void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val)
6141 {/*
6142  unsigned int _iTemp = (val);
6143  while(_iTemp--)
6144  Delay1KTCYx((GetInstructionClock()+999999)/1000000);
6145  */
6146 }
6147 void u8g_MicroDelay(void)
6148 {
6149  /* not implemented */
6150 }
6151 void u8g_10MicroDelay(void)
6152 {
6153  /* not implemented */
6154 }
6155 #endif
6156 
6157 
6158 /*== Arduino Delay ==*/
6159 #if defined(USE_ARDUINO_DELAY)
6160 void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val)
6161 {
6162 #if defined(__arm__)
6163  delayMicroseconds((uint32_t)val*(uint32_t)1000);
6164 #else
6165  delay(val);
6166 #endif
6167 }
6168 void u8g_MicroDelay(void)
6169 {
6170  delayMicroseconds(1);
6171 }
6172 void u8g_10MicroDelay(void)
6173 {
6174  delayMicroseconds(10);
6175 }
6176 #endif
6177 
6178 #if defined(USE_PIC32_DELAY)
6179 /*
6180  Assume chipkit here with F_CPU correctly defined
6181  The problem was, that u8g_Delay() is called within the constructor.
6182  It seems that the chipkit is not fully setup at this time, so a
6183  call to delay() will not work. So here is my own implementation.
6184 
6185 */
6186 #define CPU_COUNTS_PER_SECOND (F_CPU/2UL)
6187 #define TICKS_PER_MILLISECOND (CPU_COUNTS_PER_SECOND/1000UL)
6188 #include "plib.h"
6189 void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val)
6190 {
6191  uint32_t d;
6192  uint32_t s;
6193  d = val;
6194  d *= TICKS_PER_MILLISECOND;
6195  s = ReadCoreTimer();
6196  while ( (uint32_t)(ReadCoreTimer() - s) < d )
6197  ;
6198 }
6199 
6200 void u8g_MicroDelay(void)
6201 {
6202  uint32_t d;
6203  uint32_t s;
6204  d = TICKS_PER_MILLISECOND/1000;
6205  s = ReadCoreTimer();
6206  while ( (uint32_t)(ReadCoreTimer() - s) < d )
6207  ;
6208 }
6209 
6210 void u8g_10MicroDelay(void)
6211 {
6212  uint32_t d;
6213  uint32_t s;
6214  d = TICKS_PER_MILLISECOND/100;
6215  s = ReadCoreTimer();
6216  while ( (uint32_t)(ReadCoreTimer() - s) < d )
6217  ;
6218 }
6219 
6220 #endif
6221 
6222 /*== Any other systems: Dummy Delay ==*/
6223 #if defined(USE_DUMMY_DELAY)
6224 void u8g_Delay(uint16_t val)
6225 {
6226  /* do not know how to delay... */
6227 }
6228 void u8g_MicroDelay(void)
6229 {
6230 }
6231 void u8g_10MicroDelay(void)
6232 {
6233 }
6234 #endif
6235 
6236 
6237 // =============== u8g_state.c ================
6238 
6239 /*
6240 
6241  u8g_state.c
6242 
6243  backup and restore hardware state
6244 
6245  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
6246 
6247  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
6248  All rights reserved.
6249 
6250  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
6251  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
6252 
6253  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
6254  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
6255 
6256  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
6257  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
6258  materials provided with the distribution.
6259 
6260  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
6261  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
6262  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
6263  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
6264  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
6265  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
6266  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
6267  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
6268  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
6269  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
6270  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
6271  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
6272  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
6273 
6274 
6275  state callback: backup env U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_ENV
6276  device callback: DEV_MSG_INIT
6277  state callback: backup u8g U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_U8G
6278  state callback: restore env U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_ENV
6279 
6280  state callback: backup env U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_ENV
6281  state callback: retore u8g U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_U8G
6282  DEV_MSG_PAGE_FIRST or DEV_MSG_PAGE_NEXT
6283  state callback: restore env U8G_STATE_MSG_RESTORE_ENV
6284 
6285 */
6286 
6287 
6288 void u8g_state_dummy_cb(uint8_t msg)
6289 {
6290  /* the dummy procedure does nothing */
6291 }
6292 
6293 void u8g_SetHardwareBackup(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_state_cb backup_cb)
6294 {
6295  u8g->state_cb = backup_cb;
6296  /* in most cases the init message was already sent, so this will backup the */
6297  /* current u8g state */
6298  backup_cb(U8G_STATE_MSG_BACKUP_U8G);
6299 }
6300 
6301 
6302 /*===============================================================*/
6303 /* register variable for restoring interrupt state */
6304 
6305 #if defined(__AVR__)
6306 uint8_t global_SREG_backup;
6307 #endif
6308 
6309 
6310 
6311 /*===============================================================*/
6312 /* AVR */
6313 
6314 #if defined(__AVR__)
6315 #define U8G_ATMEGA_HW_SPI
6316 
6317 /* remove the definition for attiny */
6318 #if __AVR_ARCH__ == 2
6319 #undef U8G_ATMEGA_HW_SPI
6320 #endif
6321 #if __AVR_ARCH__ == 25
6322 #undef U8G_ATMEGA_HW_SPI
6323 #endif
6324 #endif
6325 
6326 #if defined(U8G_ATMEGA_HW_SPI)
6327 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
6328 static uint8_t u8g_state_avr_spi_memory[2];
6329 
6330 void u8g_backup_spi(uint8_t msg)
6331 {
6332  if ( U8G_STATE_MSG_IS_BACKUP(msg) )
6333  {
6334  u8g_state_avr_spi_memory[U8G_STATE_MSG_GET_IDX(msg)] = SPCR;
6335  }
6336  else
6337  {
6338  uint8_t tmp = SREG;
6339  cli();
6340  SPCR = 0;
6341  SPCR = u8g_state_avr_spi_memory[U8G_STATE_MSG_GET_IDX(msg)];
6342  SREG = tmp;
6343  }
6344 }
6345 
6346 #elif defined(ARDUINO) && defined(__arm__) // Arduino Due, maybe we should better check for __SAM3X8E__
6347 
6348 #include "sam.h"
6349 
6350 struct sam_backup_struct
6351 {
6352  uint32_t mr;
6353  uint32_t sr;
6354  uint32_t csr[4];
6355 } sam_backup[2];
6356 
6357 void u8g_backup_spi(uint8_t msg)
6358 {
6359  uint8_t idx = U8G_STATE_MSG_GET_IDX(msg);
6360  if ( U8G_STATE_MSG_IS_BACKUP(msg) )
6361  {
6362  sam_backup[idx].mr = SPI0->SPI_MR;
6363  sam_backup[idx].sr = SPI0->SPI_SR;
6364  sam_backup[idx].csr[0] = SPI0->SPI_CSR[0];
6365  sam_backup[idx].csr[1] = SPI0->SPI_CSR[1];
6366  sam_backup[idx].csr[2] = SPI0->SPI_CSR[2];
6367  sam_backup[idx].csr[3] = SPI0->SPI_CSR[3];
6368  }
6369  else
6370  {
6371  SPI0->SPI_MR = sam_backup[idx].mr;
6372  SPI0->SPI_CSR[0] = sam_backup[idx].csr[0];
6373  SPI0->SPI_CSR[1] = sam_backup[idx].csr[1];
6374  SPI0->SPI_CSR[2] = sam_backup[idx].csr[2];
6375  SPI0->SPI_CSR[3] = sam_backup[idx].csr[3];
6376  }
6377 }
6378 
6379 #else
6380 
6381 void u8g_backup_spi(uint8_t msg)
6382 {
6383 }
6384 
6385 #endif
6386 
6387 // =========== u8g_pb8h1.c ==============
6388 
6389 /*
6390 
6391  u8g_pb8h1.c
6392 
6393  8bit height monochrom (1 bit) page buffer
6394  byte has horizontal orientation
6395 
6396  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
6397 
6398  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
6399  All rights reserved.
6400 
6401  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
6402  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
6403 
6404  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
6405  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
6406 
6407  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
6408  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
6409  materials provided with the distribution.
6410 
6411  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
6412  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
6413  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
6414  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
6415  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
6416  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
6417  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
6418  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
6419  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
6420  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
6421  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
6422  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
6423  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
6424 
6425 
6426  total buffer size is limited to 256 bytes because of the calculation inside the set pixel procedure
6427 
6428  23. Sep 2012: Bug with down procedure, see FPS 1st page --> fixed (bug located in u8g_clip.c)
6429 
6430 */
6431 
6432 #include <string.h>
6433 
6434 #ifdef __unix__
6435 #include <assert.h>
6436 #endif
6437 
6438 /* NEW_CODE disabled, because the performance increase was too slow and not worth compared */
6439 /* to the increase of code size */
6440 /* #define NEW_CODE */
6441 
6442 #ifdef __unix__
6443 void *u8g_buf_lower_limit;
6444 void *u8g_buf_upper_limit;
6445 #endif
6446 
6447 void u8g_pb8h1_Init(u8g_pb_t *b, void *buf, u8g_uint_t width) U8G_NOINLINE;
6448 void u8g_pb8h1_set_pixel(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t color_index) U8G_NOINLINE;
6449 void u8g_pb8h1_SetPixel(u8g_pb_t *b, const u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t * const arg_pixel) U8G_NOINLINE ;
6450 void u8g_pb8h1_Set8PixelStd(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel) U8G_NOINLINE;
6451 uint8_t u8g_dev_pb8h1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
6452 
6453 
6454 #ifdef NEW_CODE
6455 struct u8g_pb_h1_struct
6456 {
6457  u8g_uint_t x;
6458  u8g_uint_t y;
6459  uint8_t *ptr;
6460  uint8_t mask;
6461  uint8_t line_byte_len;
6462  uint8_t cnt;
6463 };
6464 
6465 static uint8_t u8g_pb8h1_bitmask[8] = { 0x080, 0x040, 0x020, 0x010, 0x008, 0x004, 0x002, 0x001 };
6466 
6467 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_right(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s) U8G_NOINLINE;
6468 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_right(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s)
6469 {
6470  register u8g_uint_t x;
6471  x = s->x;
6472  x++;
6473  s->x = x;
6474  x &= 7;
6475  s->mask = u8g_pb8h1_bitmask[x];
6476  if ( x == 0 )
6477  s->ptr++;
6478 }
6479 
6480 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_left(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s)
6481 {
6482  register u8g_uint_t x;
6483  x = s->x;
6484  x--;
6485  s->x = x;
6486  x &= 7;
6487  s->mask = u8g_pb8h1_bitmask[x];
6488  if ( x == 7 )
6489  s->ptr--;
6490 }
6491 
6492 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_down(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s)
6493 {
6494  s->y++;
6495  s->ptr += s->line_byte_len;
6496 }
6497 
6498 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_up(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s)
6499 {
6500  s->y--;
6501  s->ptr -= s->line_byte_len;
6502 }
6503 
6504 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_init(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s, u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y) U8G_NOINLINE;
6505 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_init(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s, u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y)
6506 {
6507  u8g_uint_t tmp;
6508 
6509  uint8_t *ptr = b->buf;
6510 
6511  s->x = x;
6512  s->y = y;
6513 
6514  y -= b->p.page_y0;
6515 
6516  tmp = b->width;
6517  tmp >>= 3;
6518  s->line_byte_len = tmp;
6519 
6520  /* assume negative y values, can be down to -7, subtract this from the pointer and add correction of 8 to y */
6521  ptr -= tmp*8;
6522  y+=8;
6523  /* it is important that the result of tmp*y can be 16 bit value also for 8 bit mode */
6524  ptr += tmp*y;
6525 
6526  s->mask = u8g_pb8h1_bitmask[x & 7];
6527 
6528  /* assume negative x values (to -7), subtract 8 pixel from the pointer and add 8 to x */
6529  ptr--;
6530  x += 8;
6531  x >>= 3;
6532  ptr += x;
6533  s->ptr = ptr;
6534 }
6535 
6536 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s, uint8_t color_index) U8G_NOINLINE;
6537 static void u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(struct u8g_pb_h1_struct *s, uint8_t color_index)
6538 {
6539 
6540 #ifdef __unix__
6541  assert( s->ptr >= u8g_buf_lower_limit );
6542  assert( s->ptr < u8g_buf_upper_limit );
6543 #endif
6544 
6545  if ( color_index )
6546  {
6547  *s->ptr |= s->mask;
6548  }
6549  else
6550  {
6551  uint8_t mask = s->mask;
6552  mask ^=0xff;
6553  *s->ptr &= mask;
6554  }
6555 }
6556 #endif
6557 
6558 
6559 void u8g_pb8h1_Init(u8g_pb_t *b, void *buf, u8g_uint_t width)
6560 {
6561  b->buf = buf;
6562  b->width = width;
6563  u8g_pb_Clear(b);
6564 }
6565 
6566 /* limitation: total buffer must not exceed 256 bytes */
6567 void u8g_pb8h1_set_pixel(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t color_index)
6568 {
6569 #ifdef NEW_CODE
6570  struct u8g_pb_h1_struct s;
6571  u8g_pb8h1_state_init(&s, b, x, y);
6572  u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(&s, color_index);
6573 
6574 // u8g_pb8h1_state_up(&s);
6575 // if ( s.y > b->p.page_y1 )
6576 // return;
6577 // if ( s.x > b->width )
6578 // return;
6579 // u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(&s, color_index);
6580 #else
6581  register uint8_t mask;
6582  u8g_uint_t tmp;
6583  uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)b->buf;
6584 
6585  y -= b->p.page_y0;
6586  tmp = b->width;
6587  tmp >>= 3;
6588  tmp *= (uint8_t)y;
6589  ptr += tmp;
6590 
6591  mask = 0x080;
6592  mask >>= x & 7;
6593  x >>= 3;
6594  ptr += x;
6595  if ( color_index )
6596  {
6597  *ptr |= mask;
6598  }
6599  else
6600  {
6601  mask ^=0xff;
6602  *ptr &= mask;
6603  }
6604 #endif
6605 }
6606 
6607 
6608 void u8g_pb8h1_SetPixel(u8g_pb_t *b, const u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t * const arg_pixel)
6609 {
6610  if ( arg_pixel->y < b->p.page_y0 )
6611  return;
6612  if ( arg_pixel->y > b->p.page_y1 )
6613  return;
6614  if ( arg_pixel->x >= b->width )
6615  return;
6616  u8g_pb8h1_set_pixel(b, arg_pixel->x, arg_pixel->y, arg_pixel->color);
6617 }
6618 
6619 void u8g_pb8h1_Set8PixelStd(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel)
6620 {
6621  register uint8_t pixel = arg_pixel->pixel;
6622  do
6623  {
6624  if ( pixel & 128 )
6625  {
6626  u8g_pb8h1_SetPixel(b, arg_pixel);
6627  }
6628  switch( arg_pixel->dir )
6629  {
6630  case 0: arg_pixel->x++; break;
6631  case 1: arg_pixel->y++; break;
6632  case 2: arg_pixel->x--; break;
6633  case 3: arg_pixel->y--; break;
6634  }
6635  pixel <<= 1;
6636  } while( pixel != 0 );
6637 }
6638 
6639 void u8g_pb8h1_Set8PixelOpt2(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel)
6640 {
6641  register uint8_t pixel = arg_pixel->pixel;
6642  u8g_uint_t dx = 0;
6643  u8g_uint_t dy = 0;
6644 
6645  switch( arg_pixel->dir )
6646  {
6647  case 0: dx++; break;
6648  case 1: dy++; break;
6649  case 2: dx--; break;
6650  case 3: dy--; break;
6651  }
6652 
6653  do
6654  {
6655  if ( pixel & 128 )
6656  u8g_pb8h1_SetPixel(b, arg_pixel);
6657  arg_pixel->x += dx;
6658  arg_pixel->y += dy;
6659  pixel <<= 1;
6660  } while( pixel != 0 );
6661 }
6662 
6663 #ifdef NEW_CODE
6664 static void u8g_pb8h1_Set8PixelState(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel)
6665 {
6666  register uint8_t pixel = arg_pixel->pixel;
6667  struct u8g_pb_h1_struct s;
6668  uint8_t cnt;
6669  u8g_pb8h1_state_init(&s, b, arg_pixel->x, arg_pixel->y);
6670  cnt = 8;
6671  switch( arg_pixel->dir )
6672  {
6673  case 0:
6674  do
6675  {
6676  if ( s.x < b->width )
6677  if ( pixel & 128 )
6678  u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(&s, arg_pixel->color);
6679  u8g_pb8h1_state_right(&s);
6680  pixel <<= 1;
6681  cnt--;
6682  } while( cnt > 0 && pixel != 0 );
6683  break;
6684  case 1:
6685  do
6686  {
6687  if ( s.y >= b->p.page_y0 )
6688  if ( s.y <= b->p.page_y1 )
6689  if ( pixel & 128 )
6690  u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(&s, arg_pixel->color);
6691  u8g_pb8h1_state_down(&s);
6692  pixel <<= 1;
6693  cnt--;
6694  } while( cnt > 0 && pixel != 0 );
6695  break;
6696  case 2:
6697  do
6698  {
6699  if ( s.x < b->width )
6700  if ( pixel & 128 )
6701  u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(&s, arg_pixel->color);
6702  u8g_pb8h1_state_left(&s);
6703  pixel <<= 1;
6704  cnt--;
6705  } while( cnt > 0 && pixel != 0 );
6706  break;
6707  case 3:
6708  do
6709  {
6710  if ( s.y >= b->p.page_y0 )
6711  if ( s.y <= b->p.page_y1 )
6712  if ( pixel & 128 )
6713  u8g_pb8h1_state_set_pixel(&s, arg_pixel->color);
6714  u8g_pb8h1_state_up(&s);
6715  pixel <<= 1;
6716  cnt--;
6717  } while( cnt > 0 && pixel != 0 );
6718  break;
6719  }
6720 }
6721 #endif
6722 
6723 uint8_t u8g_dev_pb8h1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg)
6724 {
6725  u8g_pb_t *pb = (u8g_pb_t *)(dev->dev_mem);
6726  switch(msg)
6727  {
6728  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_8PIXEL:
6729 #ifdef NEW_CODE
6730  if ( u8g_pb_Is8PixelVisible(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg) )
6731  u8g_pb8h1_Set8PixelState(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg);
6732 #else
6733  if ( u8g_pb_Is8PixelVisible(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg) )
6734  u8g_pb8h1_Set8PixelOpt2(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg);
6735 #endif
6736  break;
6737  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_PIXEL:
6738  u8g_pb8h1_SetPixel(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg);
6739  break;
6740  case U8G_DEV_MSG_INIT:
6741  break;
6742  case U8G_DEV_MSG_STOP:
6743  break;
6744  case U8G_DEV_MSG_PAGE_FIRST:
6745  u8g_pb_Clear(pb);
6746  u8g_page_First(&(pb->p));
6747  break;
6748  case U8G_DEV_MSG_PAGE_NEXT:
6749  if ( u8g_page_Next(&(pb->p)) == 0 )
6750  return 0;
6751  u8g_pb_Clear(pb);
6752  break;
6753 #ifdef U8G_DEV_MSG_IS_BBX_INTERSECTION
6754  case U8G_DEV_MSG_IS_BBX_INTERSECTION:
6755  return u8g_pb_IsIntersection(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_bbx_t *)arg);
6756 #endif
6757  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_PAGE_BOX:
6758  u8g_pb_GetPageBox(pb, (u8g_box_t *)arg);
6759  break;
6760  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_WIDTH:
6761  *((u8g_uint_t *)arg) = pb->width;
6762  break;
6763  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_HEIGHT:
6764  *((u8g_uint_t *)arg) = pb->p.total_height;
6765  break;
6766  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_COLOR_ENTRY:
6767  break;
6768  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_XY_CB:
6769  break;
6770  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_MODE:
6771  return U8G_MODE_BW;
6772  }
6773  return 1;
6774 }
6775 
6776 // =========== u8g_com_arduino_st7920_spi.c ============
6777 /*
6778 
6779  u8g_com_arduino_st7920_spi.c
6780 
6781  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
6782 
6783  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
6784  All rights reserved.
6785 
6786  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
6787  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
6788 
6789  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
6790  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
6791 
6792  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
6793  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
6794  materials provided with the distribution.
6795 
6796  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
6797  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
6798  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
6799  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
6800  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
6801  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
6802  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
6803  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
6804  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
6805  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
6806  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
6807  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
6808  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
6809 
6810  A special SPI interface for ST7920 controller
6811 
6812  Update for ATOMIC operation done (01 Jun 2013)
6813  U8G_ATOMIC_OR(ptr, val)
6814  U8G_ATOMIC_AND(ptr, val)
6815  U8G_ATOMIC_START();
6816  U8G_ATOMIC_END();
6817 
6818 
6819 */
6820 
6821 
6822 #if defined(ARDUINO)
6823 
6824 #if defined(__AVR__)
6825 
6826 uint8_t u8g_bitData, u8g_bitNotData;
6827 uint8_t u8g_bitClock, u8g_bitNotClock;
6828 volatile uint8_t *u8g_outData;
6829 volatile uint8_t *u8g_outClock;
6830 
6831 static void u8g_com_arduino_init_shift_out(uint8_t dataPin, uint8_t clockPin)
6832 {
6833 #ifdef UI_SPI_MOSI
6834  SET_OUTPUT(UI_SPI_MOSI);
6835  SET_OUTPUT(UI_SPI_SCK);
6836  WRITE(UI_SPI_MOSI, LOW);
6837  WRITE(UI_SPI_SCK, HIGH);
6838 #endif
6839 /*
6840  u8g_outData = portOutputRegister(digitalPinToPort(dataPin));
6841  u8g_outClock = portOutputRegister(digitalPinToPort(clockPin));
6842  u8g_bitData = digitalPinToBitMask(dataPin);
6843  u8g_bitClock = digitalPinToBitMask(clockPin);
6844 
6845  u8g_bitNotClock = u8g_bitClock;
6846  u8g_bitNotClock ^= 0x0ff;
6847 
6848  u8g_bitNotData = u8g_bitData;
6849  u8g_bitNotData ^= 0x0ff;
6850 */
6851 }
6852 
6853 static void u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(uint8_t val) U8G_NOINLINE;
6854 static void u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(uint8_t val)
6855 {
6856 /*
6857  uint8_t cnt = 8;
6858  uint8_t bitData = u8g_bitData;
6859  uint8_t bitNotData = u8g_bitNotData;
6860  uint8_t bitClock = u8g_bitClock;
6861  uint8_t bitNotClock = u8g_bitNotClock;
6862  volatile uint8_t *outData = u8g_outData;
6863  volatile uint8_t *outClock = u8g_outClock;
6864 
6865 
6866  U8G_ATOMIC_START();
6867  bitData |= *outData;
6868  bitNotData &= *outData;
6869  do
6870  {
6871  if ( val & 128 )
6872  *outData = bitData;
6873  else
6874  *outData = bitNotData;
6875  val <<= 1;
6876  *outClock &= bitNotClock;
6877  cnt--;
6878  // removed micro delays, because AVRs are too slow and the delay is not required
6879  //u8g_MicroDelay();
6880  *outClock |= bitClock;
6881  //u8g_MicroDelay();
6882  } while( cnt != 0 );
6883 
6884 */
6885  U8G_ATOMIC_START();
6886  #ifdef UI_SPI_MOSI
6887 
6888  for(uint8_t cnt=0; cnt<8; cnt++ )
6889  {
6890  WRITE(UI_SPI_SCK, LOW);
6891  WRITE(UI_SPI_MOSI, val&0x80);
6892  val<<=1;
6893  asm volatile("nop\n\t"
6894 "nop\n\t"
6895 "nop\n\t"
6896 "nop\n\t"
6897 ::);
6898  //u8g_MicroDelay();
6899  WRITE(UI_SPI_SCK, HIGH);
6900 asm volatile("nop\n\t"
6901 "nop\n\t"
6902 "nop\n\t"
6903 "nop\n\t"
6904 ::);
6905  //u8g_MicroDelay();
6906  }
6907  #endif
6908  U8G_ATOMIC_END();
6909 }
6910 
6911 #elif defined(__18CXX) || defined(__PIC32MX)
6912 
6913 uint16_t dog_bitData, dog_bitNotData;
6914 uint16_t dog_bitClock, dog_bitNotClock;
6915 volatile uint32_t *dog_outData;
6916 volatile uint32_t *dog_outClock;
6917 volatile uint32_t dog_pic32_spi_tmp;
6918 
6919 static void u8g_com_arduino_init_shift_out(uint8_t dataPin, uint8_t clockPin)
6920 {
6921  dog_outData = portOutputRegister(digitalPinToPort(dataPin));
6922  dog_outClock = portOutputRegister(digitalPinToPort(clockPin));
6923  dog_bitData = digitalPinToBitMask(dataPin);
6924  dog_bitClock = digitalPinToBitMask(clockPin);
6925 
6926  dog_bitNotClock = dog_bitClock;
6927  dog_bitNotClock ^= 0x0ffff;
6928 
6929  dog_bitNotData = dog_bitData;
6930  dog_bitNotData ^= 0x0ffff;
6931 }
6932 
6933 static void u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(uint8_t val)
6934 {
6935  uint8_t cnt = 8;
6936  U8G_ATOMIC_START();
6937  do
6938  {
6939  if ( val & 128 )
6940  *dog_outData |= dog_bitData;
6941  else
6942  *dog_outData &= dog_bitNotData;
6943  val <<= 1;
6944  //u8g_MicroDelay();
6945  //*dog_outClock |= dog_bitClock;
6946  *dog_outClock &= dog_bitNotClock;
6947  cnt--;
6948  u8g_MicroDelay();
6949  //*dog_outClock &= dog_bitNotClock;
6950  *dog_outClock |= dog_bitClock;
6951  u8g_MicroDelay();
6952 
6953  } while( cnt != 0 );
6954  U8G_ATOMIC_END();
6955 }
6956 
6957 #else
6958 
6959 /* default interface, Arduino DUE (__arm__) */
6960 
6961 uint8_t u8g_data_pin;
6962 uint8_t u8g_clock_pin;
6963 
6964 static void u8g_com_arduino_init_shift_out(uint8_t dataPin, uint8_t clockPin)
6965 {
6966  u8g_data_pin = dataPin;
6967  u8g_clock_pin = clockPin;
6968 }
6969 
6970 static void u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(uint8_t val)
6971 {
6972  uint8_t cnt = 8;
6973  do
6974  {
6975 #ifdef UI_SPI_MOSI
6976  WRITE(UI_SPI_MOSI,val & 128);
6977 #else
6978  if ( val & 128 )
6979  digitalWrite(u8g_data_pin, HIGH);
6980  else
6981  digitalWrite(u8g_data_pin, LOW);
6982 #endif
6983  val <<= 1;
6984  u8g_MicroDelay();
6985 #ifdef UI_SPI_SCK
6986  WRITE(UI_SPI_SCK,LOW);
6987 #else
6988  digitalWrite(u8g_clock_pin, LOW);
6989 #endif
6990  cnt--;
6991  u8g_MicroDelay();
6992 #ifdef UI_SPI_SCK
6993  WRITE(UI_SPI_SCK,HIGH);
6994 #else
6995  digitalWrite(u8g_clock_pin, HIGH);
6996 #endif
6997  u8g_MicroDelay();
6998  } while( cnt != 0 );
6999 }
7000 
7001 #endif
7002 
7003 
7004 static void u8g_com_arduino_st7920_write_byte_seq(uint8_t rs, uint8_t *ptr, uint8_t len)
7005 {
7006  if ( rs == 0 )
7007  {
7008  /* command */
7009  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(0x0f8);
7010  }
7011  else if ( rs == 1 )
7012  {
7013  /* data */
7014  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(0x0fa);
7015  }
7016 
7017  while( len > 0 )
7018  {
7019  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(*ptr & 0x0f0);
7020  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(*ptr << 4);
7021  ptr++;
7022  len--;
7023 // u8g_10MicroDelay();
7024  }
7025 
7026 // for( i = 0; i < 4; i++ )
7027  u8g_10MicroDelay();
7028 }
7029 
7030 static void u8g_com_arduino_st7920_write_byte(uint8_t rs, uint8_t val)
7031 {
7032  if ( rs == 0 )
7033  {
7034  /* command */
7035  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(0x0f8);
7036  }
7037  else if ( rs == 1 )
7038  {
7039  /* data */
7040  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(0x0fa);
7041  }
7042 
7043  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(val & 0x0f0);
7044  u8g_com_arduino_do_shift_out_msb_first(val << 4);
7045 
7046 // for( i = 0; i < 4; i++ )
7047  u8g_10MicroDelay();
7048 
7049 }
7050 
7051 
7052 uint8_t u8g_com_arduino_st7920_spi_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
7053 {
7054  switch(msg)
7055  {
7056  case U8G_COM_MSG_INIT:
7057  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_CS2]=U8G_PIN_NONE;
7058  u8g_com_arduino_assign_pin_output_high(u8g);
7059 #ifdef UI_SPI_CS
7060  WRITE(UI_SPI_CS,LOW);
7061 #else
7062  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, LOW);
7063 #endif
7064  // u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, LOW);
7065 #ifdef UI_SPI_SCK
7066  WRITE(UI_SPI_SCK,HIGH);
7067 #else
7068  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, HIGH);
7069 #endif
7070 #ifdef UI_SPI_MOSI
7071  WRITE(UI_SPI_MOSI,LOW);
7072 #else
7073  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_MOSI, LOW);
7074 #endif
7075  u8g_com_arduino_init_shift_out(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_MOSI], u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SCK]);
7076  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 0; /* inital RS state: command mode */
7077  break;
7078 
7079  case U8G_COM_MSG_STOP:
7080  break;
7081 
7082  case U8G_COM_MSG_RESET:
7083  if ( u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_RESET] != U8G_PIN_NONE )
7084  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_RESET, arg_val);
7085  break;
7086 
7087  case U8G_COM_MSG_CHIP_SELECT:
7088 #ifdef UI_SPI_CS
7089  WRITE(UI_SPI_CS,arg_val);
7090 #else
7091  if ( arg_val == 0 )
7092  {
7093  /* disable, note: the st7920 has an active high chip select */
7094  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, LOW);
7095  }
7096  else
7097  {
7098  /* enable */
7099  //u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SCK, HIGH);
7100  u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_CS, HIGH);
7101  }
7102 #endif
7103  break;
7104 
7105  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_BYTE:
7106  u8g_com_arduino_st7920_write_byte( u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE], arg_val);
7107  //u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 2;
7108  //u8g_arduino_sw_spi_shift_out(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_MOSI], u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SCK], arg_val);
7109  break;
7110 
7111  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ:
7112  u8g_com_arduino_st7920_write_byte_seq(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE], (uint8_t *)arg_ptr, arg_val);
7113  break;
7114 
7115  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ_P:
7116  {
7117  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
7118  while( arg_val > 0 )
7119  {
7120  u8g_com_arduino_st7920_write_byte(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE], u8g_pgm_read(ptr) );
7121  //u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 2;
7122  ptr++;
7123  arg_val--;
7124  }
7125  }
7126  break;
7127 
7128  case U8G_COM_MSG_ADDRESS: /* define cmd (arg_val = 0) or data mode (arg_val = 1) */
7129  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = arg_val;
7130  break;
7131  }
7132  return 1;
7133 }
7134 
7135 #else /* ARDUINO */
7136 
7137 uint8_t u8g_com_arduino_st7920_spi_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
7138 {
7139  return 1;
7140 }
7141 
7142 #endif /* ARDUINO */
7143

7157  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

7160  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
7161

7163  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
7164  materials provided with the distribution.
7165

7167  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
7168  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
7169  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
7170  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
7171  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
7172  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
7173  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
7174  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
7175  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
7176  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)

7178  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
