7183 
7184 #if defined(ARDUINO)
7185 
7186 
7187 void u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t pin_index, uint8_t value)
7188 {
7189  uint8_t pin;
7190  pin = u8g->pin_list[pin_index];
7191  if ( pin != U8G_PIN_NONE )
7192  digitalWrite(pin, value);
7193 }
7194 
7195 /* this procedure does not set the RW pin */
7196 void u8g_com_arduino_assign_pin_output_high(u8g_t *u8g)
7197 {
7198  uint8_t i;
7199  /* skip the RW pin, which is the last pin in the list */
7200  for( i = 0; i < U8G_PIN_LIST_LEN-1; i++ )
7201  {
7202  if ( u8g->pin_list[i] != U8G_PIN_NONE )
7203  {
7204  pinMode(u8g->pin_list[i], OUTPUT);
7205  digitalWrite(u8g->pin_list[i], HIGH);
7206  }
7207  }
7208 }
7209 
7210 
7211 #endif
7212 
7213 /*
7214 
7215  u8g_pb.c
7216 
7217  common procedures for the page buffer
7218 
7219  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
7220 
7221  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
7222  All rights reserved.
7223 
7224  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
7225  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
7226 
7227  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
7228  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
7229 
7230  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
7231  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
7232  materials provided with the distribution.
7233 
7234  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
7235  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
7236  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
7237  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
7238  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
7239  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
7240  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
7241  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
7242  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
7243  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
7244  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
7245  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
7246  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
7247 
7248 
7249 */
7250 
7251 
7252 void u8g_pb_Clear(u8g_pb_t *b)
7253 {
7254  uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t *)b->buf;
7255  uint8_t *end_ptr = ptr;
7256  end_ptr += b->width;
7257  do
7258  {
7259  *ptr++ = 0;
7260  } while( ptr != end_ptr );
7261 }
7262 
7263 /* the following procedure does not work. why? Can be checked with descpic */
7264 /*
7265 void u8g_pb_Clear(u8g_pb_t *b)
7266 {
7267  uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t *)b->buf;
7268  uint8_t cnt = b->width;
7269  do
7270  {
7271  *ptr++ = 0;
7272  cnt--;
7273  } while( cnt != 0 );
7274 }
7275 */
7276 
7277 /*
7278  intersection assumptions:
7279  a1 <= a2 is always true
7280 */
7281  /*
7282  minimized version
7283  ---1----0 1 b1 <= a2 && b1 > b2
7284  -----1--0 1 b2 >= a1 && b1 > b2
7285  ---1-1--- 1 b1 <= a2 && b2 >= a1
7286  */
7287 /*
7288 uint8_t u8g_pb8v1_IsYIntersection___Old(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
7289 {
7290  uint8_t c0, c1, c;
7291  c0 = v0 <= b->p.page_y1;
7292  c1 = v1 >= b->p.page_y0;
7293  c = v0 > v1;
7294  if ( c0 && c1 ) return 1;
7295  if ( c0 && c ) return 1;
7296  if ( c1 && c ) return 1;
7297  return 0;
7298 }
7299 */
7300 
7301 uint8_t u8g_pb_IsYIntersection(u8g_pb_t *pb, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
7302 {
7303  uint8_t c1, c2, c3, tmp;
7304  c1 = v0 <= pb->p.page_y1;
7305  c2 = v1 >= pb->p.page_y0;
7306  c3 = v0 > v1;
7307  /*
7308  if ( c1 && c2 )
7309  return 1;
7310  if ( c1 && c3 )
7311  return 1;
7312  if ( c2 && c3 )
7313  return 1;
7314  return 0;
7315  */
7316 
7317  tmp = c1;
7318  c1 &= c2;
7319  c2 &= c3;
7320  c3 &= tmp;
7321  c1 |= c2;
7322  c1 |= c3;
7323  return c1 & 1;
7324 }
7325 
7326 
7327 uint8_t u8g_pb_IsXIntersection(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1)
7328 {
7329  uint8_t /*c0, c1, */ c2, c3;
7330  /*
7331  conditions: b->p.page_y0 < b->p.page_y1
7332  there are no restriction on v0 and v1. If v0 > v1, then warp around unsigned is assumed
7333  */
7334  /*
7335  c0 = v0 < 0;
7336  c1 = v1 < 0;
7337  */
7338  c2 = v0 > b->width;
7339  c3 = v1 > b->width;
7340  /*if ( c0 && c1 ) return 0;*/
7341  if ( c2 && c3 ) return 0;
7342  /*if ( c1 && c2 ) return 0;*/
7343  return 1;
7344 }
7345 
7346 uint8_t u8g_pb_IsIntersection(u8g_pb_t *pb, u8g_dev_arg_bbx_t *bbx)
7347 {
7348  u8g_uint_t tmp;
7349 
7350  tmp = bbx->y;
7351  tmp += bbx->h;
7352  tmp--;
7353 
7354  if ( u8g_pb_IsYIntersection(pb, bbx->y, tmp) == 0 )
7355  return 0;
7356 
7357  /* maybe this one can be skiped... probability is very high to have an intersection, so it would be ok to always return 1 */
7358  tmp = bbx->x;
7359  tmp += bbx->w;
7360  tmp--;
7361 
7362  return u8g_pb_IsXIntersection(pb, bbx->x, tmp);
7363 }
7364 
7365 void u8g_pb_GetPageBox(u8g_pb_t *pb, u8g_box_t *box)
7366 {
7367  box->x0 = 0;
7368  box->y0 = pb->p.page_y0;
7369  box->x1 = pb->width;
7370  box->x1--;
7371  box->y1 = pb->p.page_y1;
7372 }
7373 
7374 
7375 uint8_t u8g_pb_Is8PixelVisible(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel)
7376 {
7377  u8g_uint_t v0, v1;
7378  v0 = arg_pixel->y;
7379  v1 = v0;
7380  switch( arg_pixel->dir )
7381  {
7382  case 0:
7383  break;
7384  case 1:
7385  v1 += 8; /* this is independent from the page height */
7386  break;
7387  case 2:
7388  break;
7389  case 3:
7390  v0 -= 8;
7391  break;
7392  }
7393  return u8g_pb_IsYIntersection(b, v0, v1);
7394 }
7395 
7396 
7397 
7398 uint8_t u8g_pb_WriteBuffer(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev)
7399 {
7400  return u8g_WriteSequence(u8g, dev, b->width,(uint8_t*) b->buf);
7401 }
7402 
7403 /*
7404 
7405  u8g_rect.c
7406 
7407  U8G high level interface for horizontal and vertical things
7408 
7409  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
7410 
7411  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
7412  All rights reserved.
7413 
7414  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
7415  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
7416 
7417  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
7418  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
7419 
7420  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
7421  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
7422  materials provided with the distribution.
7423 
7424  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
7425  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
7426  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
7427  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
7428  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
7429  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
7430  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
7431  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
7432  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
7433  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
7434  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
7435  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
7436  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
7437 
7438 
7439 */
7440 
7441 void u8g_draw_hline(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w)
7442 {
7443  uint8_t pixel = 0x0ff;
7444  while( w >= 8 )
7445  {
7446  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 0, pixel);
7447  w-=8;
7448  x+=8;
7449  }
7450  if ( w != 0 )
7451  {
7452  w ^=7;
7453  w++;
7454  pixel <<= w&7;
7455  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 0, pixel);
7456  }
7457 }
7458 
7459 void u8g_draw_vline(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t h)
7460 {
7461  uint8_t pixel = 0x0ff;
7462  while( h >= 8 )
7463  {
7464  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 1, pixel);
7465  h-=8;
7466  y+=8;
7467  }
7468  if ( h != 0 )
7469  {
7470  h ^=7;
7471  h++;
7472  pixel <<= h&7;
7473  u8g_Draw8Pixel(u8g, x, y, 1, pixel);
7474  }
7475 }
7476 
7477 void u8g_DrawHLine(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w)
7478 {
7479  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, 1) == 0 )
7480  return;
7481  u8g_draw_hline(u8g, x, y, w);
7482 }
7483 
7484 void u8g_DrawVLine(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w)
7485 {
7486  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, 1, w) == 0 )
7487  return;
7488  u8g_draw_vline(u8g, x, y, w);
7489 }
7490 
7491 /* restrictions: w > 0 && h > 0 */
7492 void u8g_DrawFrame(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h)
7493 {
7494  u8g_uint_t xtmp = x;
7495 
7496  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, h) == 0 )
7497  return;
7498 
7499 
7500  u8g_draw_hline(u8g, x, y, w);
7501  u8g_draw_vline(u8g, x, y, h);
7502  x+=w;
7503  x--;
7504  u8g_draw_vline(u8g, x, y, h);
7505  y+=h;
7506  y--;
7507  u8g_draw_hline(u8g, xtmp, y, w);
7508 }
7509 
7510 void u8g_draw_box(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h)
7511 {
7512  do
7513  {
7514  u8g_draw_hline(u8g, x, y, w);
7515  y++;
7516  h--;
7517  } while( h != 0 );
7518 }
7519 
7520 /* restrictions: h > 0 */
7521 void u8g_DrawBox(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h)
7522 {
7523  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, h) == 0 )
7524  return;
7525  u8g_draw_box(u8g, x, y, w, h);
7526 }
7527 
7528 
7529 void u8g_DrawRFrame(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h, u8g_uint_t r)
7530 {
7531  u8g_uint_t xl, yu;
7532 
7533  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, h) == 0 )
7534  return;
7535 
7536  xl = x;
7537  xl += r;
7538  yu = y;
7539  yu += r;
7540 
7541  {
7542  u8g_uint_t yl, xr;
7543 
7544  xr = x;
7545  xr += w;
7546  xr -= r;
7547  xr -= 1;
7548 
7549  yl = y;
7550  yl += h;
7551  yl -= r;
7552  yl -= 1;
7553 
7554  u8g_draw_circle(u8g, xl, yu, r, U8G_DRAW_UPPER_LEFT);
7555  u8g_draw_circle(u8g, xr, yu, r, U8G_DRAW_UPPER_RIGHT);
7556  u8g_draw_circle(u8g, xl, yl, r, U8G_DRAW_LOWER_LEFT);
7557  u8g_draw_circle(u8g, xr, yl, r, U8G_DRAW_LOWER_RIGHT);
7558  }
7559 
7560  {
7561  u8g_uint_t ww, hh;
7562 
7563  ww = w;
7564  ww -= r;
7565  ww -= r;
7566  ww -= 2;
7567  hh = h;
7568  hh -= r;
7569  hh -= r;
7570  hh -= 2;
7571 
7572  xl++;
7573  yu++;
7574  h--;
7575  w--;
7576  u8g_draw_hline(u8g, xl, y, ww);
7577  u8g_draw_hline(u8g, xl, y+h, ww);
7578  u8g_draw_vline(u8g, x, yu, hh);
7579  u8g_draw_vline(u8g, x+w, yu, hh);
7580  }
7581 }
7582 
7583 void u8g_DrawRBox(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, u8g_uint_t w, u8g_uint_t h, u8g_uint_t r)
7584 {
7585  u8g_uint_t xl, yu;
7586  u8g_uint_t yl, xr;
7587 
7588  if ( u8g_IsBBXIntersection(u8g, x, y, w, h) == 0 )
7589  return;
7590 
7591  xl = x;
7592  xl += r;
7593  yu = y;
7594  yu += r;
7595 
7596  xr = x;
7597  xr += w;
7598  xr -= r;
7599  xr -= 1;
7600 
7601  yl = y;
7602  yl += h;
7603  yl -= r;
7604  yl -= 1;
7605 
7606  u8g_draw_disc(u8g, xl, yu, r, U8G_DRAW_UPPER_LEFT);
7607  u8g_draw_disc(u8g, xr, yu, r, U8G_DRAW_UPPER_RIGHT);
7608  u8g_draw_disc(u8g, xl, yl, r, U8G_DRAW_LOWER_LEFT);
7609  u8g_draw_disc(u8g, xr, yl, r, U8G_DRAW_LOWER_RIGHT);
7610 
7611  {
7612  u8g_uint_t ww, hh;
7613 
7614  ww = w;
7615  ww -= r;
7616  ww -= r;
7617  ww -= 2;
7618  hh = h;
7619  hh -= r;
7620  hh -= r;
7621  hh -= 2;
7622 
7623  xl++;
7624  yu++;
7625  h--;
7626  u8g_draw_box(u8g, xl, y, ww, r+1);
7627  u8g_draw_box(u8g, xl, yl, ww, r+1);
7628  //u8g_draw_hline(u8g, xl, y+h, ww);
7629  u8g_draw_box(u8g, x, yu, w, hh);
7630  //u8g_draw_vline(u8g, x+w, yu, hh);
7631  }
7632 }
7633 
7634 // ============ u8g_com_arduino_ssd_i2c.c =================
7635 
7636 /*
7637 
7638  u8g_com_arduino_ssd_i2c.c
7639 
7640  com interface for arduino (AND atmega) and the SSDxxxx chip (SOLOMON) variant
7641  I2C protocol
7642 
7643  ToDo: Rename this to u8g_com_avr_ssd_i2c.c
7644 
7645  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
7646 
7647  Copyright (c) 2012, olikraus@gmail.com
7648  All rights reserved.
7649 
7650  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
7651  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
7652 
7653  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
7654  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
7655 
7656  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
7657  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
7658  materials provided with the distribution.
7659 
7660  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
7661  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
7662  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
7663  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
7664  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
7665  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
7666  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
7667  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
7668  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
7669  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
7670  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
7671  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
7672  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
7673 
7674  Special pin usage:
7675  U8G_PI_I2C_OPTION additional options
7676  U8G_PI_A0_STATE used to store the last value of the command/data register selection
7677  U8G_PI_SET_A0 1: Signal request to update I2C device with new A0_STATE, 0: Do nothing, A0_STATE matches I2C device
7678  U8G_PI_SCL clock line (NOT USED)
7679  U8G_PI_SDA data line (NOT USED)
7680 
7681  U8G_PI_RESET reset line (currently disabled, see below)
7682 
7683  Protocol:
7684  SLA, Cmd/Data Selection, Arguments
7685  The command/data register is selected by a special instruction byte, which is sent after SLA
7686 
7687  The continue bit is always 0 so that a (re)start is equired for the change from cmd to/data mode
7688 */
7689 
7690 
7691 #if defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST)
7692 
7693 
7694 #define I2C_SLA (0x3c*2)
7695 //#define I2C_CMD_MODE 0x080
7696 #define I2C_CMD_MODE 0x000
7697 #define I2C_DATA_MODE 0x040
7698 
7699 uint8_t u8g_com_arduino_ssd_start_sequence(u8g_t *u8g)
7700 {
7701  /* are we requested to set the a0 state? */
7702  if ( u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] == 0 )
7703  return 1;
7704 
7705  /* setup bus, might be a repeated start */
7706  if ( u8g_i2c_start(I2C_SLA) == 0 )
7707  return 0;
7708  if ( u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] == 0 )
7709  {
7710  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(I2C_CMD_MODE) == 0 )
7711  return 0;
7712  }
7713  else
7714  {
7715  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(I2C_DATA_MODE) == 0 )
7716  return 0;
7717  }
7718 
7719  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] = 0;
7720  return 1;
7721 }
7722 
7723 uint8_t u8g_com_arduino_ssd_i2c_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
7724 {
7725  switch(msg)
7726  {
7727  case U8G_COM_MSG_INIT:
7728  //u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SCL, HIGH);
7729  //u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_SDA, HIGH);
7730  //u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 0; /* inital RS state: unknown mode */
7731 
7732  u8g_i2c_init(u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_I2C_OPTION]);
7733 
7734  break;
7735 
7736  case U8G_COM_MSG_STOP:
7737  break;
7738 
7739  case U8G_COM_MSG_RESET:
7740  /* Currently disabled, but it could be enable. Previous restrictions have been removed */
7741  /* u8g_com_arduino_digital_write(u8g, U8G_PI_RESET, arg_val); */
7742  break;
7743 
7744  case U8G_COM_MSG_CHIP_SELECT:
7745  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = 0;
7746  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] = 1; /* force a0 to set again, also forces start condition */
7747  if ( arg_val == 0 )
7748  {
7749  /* disable chip, send stop condition */
7750  u8g_i2c_stop();
7751  }
7752  else
7753  {
7754  /* enable, do nothing: any byte writing will trigger the i2c start */
7755  }
7756  break;
7757 
7758  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_BYTE:
7759  //u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] = 1;
7760  if ( u8g_com_arduino_ssd_start_sequence(u8g) == 0 )
7761  return u8g_i2c_stop(), 0;
7762  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(arg_val) == 0 )
7763  return u8g_i2c_stop(), 0;
7764  // u8g_i2c_stop();
7765  break;
7766 
7767  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ:
7768  //u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] = 1;
7769  if ( u8g_com_arduino_ssd_start_sequence(u8g) == 0 )
7770  return u8g_i2c_stop(), 0;
7771  {
7772  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
7773  while( arg_val > 0 )
7774  {
7775  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(*ptr++) == 0 )
7776  return u8g_i2c_stop(), 0;
7777  arg_val--;
7778  }
7779  }
7780  // u8g_i2c_stop();
7781  break;
7782 
7783  case U8G_COM_MSG_WRITE_SEQ_P:
7784  //u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] = 1;
7785  if ( u8g_com_arduino_ssd_start_sequence(u8g) == 0 )
7786  return u8g_i2c_stop(), 0;
7787  {
7788  register uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)arg_ptr;
7789  while( arg_val > 0 )
7790  {
7791  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(u8g_pgm_read(ptr)) == 0 )
7792  return 0;
7793  ptr++;
7794  arg_val--;
7795  }
7796  }
7797  // u8g_i2c_stop();
7798  break;
7799 
7800  case U8G_COM_MSG_ADDRESS: /* define cmd (arg_val = 0) or data mode (arg_val = 1) */
7801  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_A0_STATE] = arg_val;
7802  u8g->pin_list[U8G_PI_SET_A0] = 1; /* force a0 to set again */
7803 
7804 #ifdef OLD_CODE
7805  if ( i2c_state != 0 )
7806  {
7807  u8g_i2c_stop();
7808  i2c_state = 0;
7809  }
7810 
7811  if ( u8g_com_arduino_ssd_start_sequence(arg_val) == 0 )
7812  return 0;
7813 
7814  /* setup bus, might be a repeated start */
7815  /*
7816  if ( u8g_i2c_start(I2C_SLA) == 0 )
7817  return 0;
7818  if ( arg_val == 0 )
7819  {
7820  i2c_state = 1;
7821 
7822  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(I2C_CMD_MODE) == 0 )
7823  return 0;
7824  }
7825  else
7826  {
7827  i2c_state = 2;
7828  if ( u8g_i2c_send_byte(I2C_DATA_MODE) == 0 )
7829  return 0;
7830  }
7831  */
7832 #endif
7833  break;
7834  }
7835  return 1;
7836 }
7837 
7838 #else /* defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST) */
7839 
7840 uint8_t u8g_com_arduino_ssd_i2c_fn(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr)
7841 {
7842  return 1;
7843 }
7844 
7845 #endif /* defined(U8G_WITH_PINLIST) */
7846 
7847 // ============ u8g_com_i2c.c ===============
7848 
7849 /*
7850 
7851  u8g_com_i2c.c
7852 
7853  generic i2c interface
7854 
7855  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
7856 
7857  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
7858  All rights reserved.
7859 
7860  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
7861  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
7862 
7863  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
7864  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
7865 
7866  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
7867  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
7868  materials provided with the distribution.
7869 
7870  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
7871  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
7872  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
7873  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
7874  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
7875  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
7876  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
7877  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
7878  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
7879  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
7880  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
7881  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
7882  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
7883 
7884 */
7885 
7886 
7887 //#define U8G_I2C_WITH_NO_ACK
7888 
7889 static uint8_t u8g_i2c_err_code;
7890 static uint8_t u8g_i2c_opt; /* U8G_I2C_OPT_NO_ACK, SAM: U8G_I2C_OPT_DEV_1 */
7891 /*
7892  position values
7893  1: start condition
7894  2: sla transfer
7895 */
7896 static uint8_t u8g_i2c_err_pos;
7897 
7898 
7899 void u8g_i2c_clear_error(void)
7900 {
7901  u8g_i2c_err_code = U8G_I2C_ERR_NONE;
7902  u8g_i2c_err_pos = 0;
7903 }
7904 
7905 uint8_t u8g_i2c_get_error(void)
7906 {
7907  return u8g_i2c_err_code;
7908 }
7909 
7910 uint8_t u8g_i2c_get_err_pos(void)
7911 {
7912  return u8g_i2c_err_pos;
7913 }
7914 
7915 static void u8g_i2c_set_error(uint8_t code, uint8_t pos)
7916 {
7917  if ( u8g_i2c_err_code > 0 )
7918  return;
7919  u8g_i2c_err_code |= code;
7920  u8g_i2c_err_pos = pos;
7921 }
7922 
7923 
7924 
7925 #if defined(__AVR__)
7926 #define U8G_ATMEGA_HW_TWI
7927 
7928 /* remove the definition for attiny */
7929 #if __AVR_ARCH__ == 2
7930 #undef U8G_ATMEGA_HW_TWI
7931 #endif
7932 #if __AVR_ARCH__ == 25
7933 #undef U8G_ATMEGA_HW_TWI
7934 #endif
7935 #endif
7936 
7937 #if defined(U8G_ATMEGA_HW_TWI)
7938 
7939 #include <avr/io.h>
7940 #include <util/twi.h>
7941 
7942 
7943 
7944 void u8g_i2c_init(uint8_t options)
7945 {
7946  /*
7947  TWBR: bit rate register
7948  TWSR: status register (contains preselector bits)
7949 
7950  prescalar
7951  0 1
7952  1 4
7953  2 16
7954  3 64
7955 
7956  f = F_CPU/(16+2*TWBR*prescalar)
7957 
7958  F_CPU = 16MHz
7959  TWBR = 152;
7960  TWSR = 0;
7961  --> 50KHz
7962 
7963  TWBR = 72;
7964  TWSR = 0;
7965  --> 100KHz
7966 
7967  TWBR = 12;
7968  TWSR = 0;
7969  --> 400KHz
7970 
7971  F_CPU/(2*100000)-8 --> calculate TWBR value for 100KHz
7972 */
7973  u8g_i2c_opt = options;
7974  TWSR = 0;
7975  if ( options & U8G_I2C_OPT_FAST )
7976  {
7977  TWBR = F_CPU/(2*400000)-8;
7978  }
7979  else
7980  {
7981  TWBR = F_CPU/(2*100000)-8;
7982  }
7983  u8g_i2c_clear_error();
7984 }
7985 
7986 uint8_t u8g_i2c_wait(uint8_t mask, uint8_t pos)
7987 {
7988  volatile uint16_t cnt = 2000; /* timout value should be > 280 for 50KHz Bus and 16 Mhz CPU, however the start condition might need longer */
7989  while( !(TWCR & mask) )
7990  {
7991  if ( cnt == 0 )
7992  {
7993  if ( u8g_i2c_opt & U8G_I2C_OPT_NO_ACK )
7994  {
7995  return 1; /* all ok */
7996  }
7997  else
7998  {
7999  u8g_i2c_set_error(U8G_I2C_ERR_TIMEOUT, pos);
8000  return 0; /* error */
8001  }
8002  }
8003  cnt--;
8004  }
8005  return 1; /* all ok */
8006 }
8007 
8008 /* sla includes all 8 bits (with r/w bit), assums master transmit */
8009 uint8_t u8g_i2c_start(uint8_t sla)
8010 {
8011  register uint8_t status;
8012 
8013  /* send start */
8014  TWCR = _BV(TWINT) | _BV(TWSTA) | _BV(TWEN);
8015 
8016  /* wait */
8017  if ( u8g_i2c_wait(_BV(TWINT), 1) == 0 )
8018  return 0;
8019 
8020  status = TW_STATUS;
8021 
8022  /* check status after start */
8023  if ( status != TW_START && status != TW_REP_START )
8024  {
8025  u8g_i2c_set_error(U8G_I2C_ERR_BUS, 1);
8026  return 0;
8027  }
8028 
8029  /* set slave address */
8030  TWDR = sla;
8031 
8032  /* enable sla transfer */
8033  TWCR = _BV(TWINT) | _BV(TWEN);
8034 
8035  /* wait */
8036  if ( u8g_i2c_wait(_BV(TWINT), 2) == 0 )
8037  return 0;
8038 
8039  if ( u8g_i2c_opt & U8G_I2C_OPT_NO_ACK )
8040  {
8041  /* do not check for ACK */
8042  }
8043  else
8044  {
8045  status = TW_STATUS;
8046  /* check status after sla */
8047  if ( status != TW_MT_SLA_ACK )
8048  {
8049  u8g_i2c_set_error(U8G_I2C_ERR_BUS, 2);
8050  return 0;
8051  }
8052  }
8053 
8054  return 1;
8055 }
8056 
8057 uint8_t u8g_i2c_send_byte(uint8_t data)
8058 {
8059  register uint8_t status;
8060  TWDR = data;
8061  TWCR = _BV(TWINT) | _BV(TWEN);
8062  if ( u8g_i2c_wait(_BV(TWINT), 3) == 0 )
8063  return 0;
8064 
8065  if ( u8g_i2c_opt & U8G_I2C_OPT_NO_ACK )
8066  {
8067  /* do not check for ACK */
8068  }
8069  else
8070  {
8071  status = TW_STATUS;
8072  if ( status != TW_MT_DATA_ACK )
8073  {
8074  u8g_i2c_set_error(U8G_I2C_ERR_BUS, 3);
8075  return 0;
8076  }
8077  }
8078 
8079  return 1;
8080 }
8081 
8082 void u8g_i2c_stop(void)
8083 {
8084  /* write stop */
8085  TWCR = _BV(TWINT) | _BV(TWEN) | _BV(TWSTO);
8086 
8087  /* no error is checked for the stop condition */
8088  u8g_i2c_wait(_BV(TWSTO), 4);
8089 
8090 }
8091 
8092 /*
8093 void twi_send(uint8_t adr, uint8_t data1, uint8_t data2)
8094 {
8095  u8g_i2c_start(adr<<1);
8096  u8g_i2c_send_byte(data1);
8097  u8g_i2c_send_byte(data2);
8098  u8g_i2c_stop();
8099 }
8100 */
8101 
8102 #elif defined(ARDUINO) && defined(__SAM3X8E__)
8103 /* Arduino Due */
8104 #include "Arduino.h"
8105 #include "sam.h"
8106 
8107 /*
8108 
8109 Controller
8110 
8111 TWI0 TWCK0 PA18 A DUE PCB: SCL1
8112 TWI0 TWD0 PA17 A DUE PCB: SDA1
8113 TWI1 TWCK1 PB13 A DUE PCB: SCL 21
8114 TWI1 TWD1 PB12 A DUE PCB: SDA 20
8115 
8116 Arduino definitions
8117 
8118 #define PIN_WIRE_SDA (20u)
8119 #define PIN_WIRE_SCL (21u)
8120 #define WIRE_INTERFACE TWI1
8121 #define WIRE_INTERFACE_ID ID_TWI1
8122 #define WIRE_ISR_HANDLER TWI1_Handler
8123 
8124 #define PIN_WIRE1_SDA (70u)
8125 #define PIN_WIRE1_SCL (71u)
8126 #define WIRE1_INTERFACE TWI0
8127 #define WIRE1_INTERFACE_ID ID_TWI0
8128 #define WIRE1_ISR_HANDLER TWI0_Handler
8129 
8130 
8131 */
8132 
8133 static void i2c_400KHz_delay(void)
8134 {
8135  /* should be at least 4 */
8136  /* should be 5 for 100KHz transfer speed */
8137 
8138 
8139  /*
8140  Arduino Due
8141  0x NOP: 470KHz
8142  4x NOP: 450KHz
8143  8x NOP: 430KHz
8144  16x NOP: 400KHz
8145  */
8146 
8147  __NOP();
8148  __NOP();
8149  __NOP();
8150  __NOP();
8151 
8152  __NOP();
8153  __NOP();
8154  __NOP();
8155  __NOP();
8156 
8157  __NOP();
8158  __NOP();
8159  __NOP();
8160  __NOP();
8161 
8162  __NOP();
8163  __NOP();
8164  __NOP();
8165  __NOP();
8166 }
8167 
8168 static void i2c_100KHz_delay(void)
8169 {
8170  /*
8171  1x u8g_MicroDelay() ca. 130KHz
8172  2x u8g_MicroDelay() ca. 80KHz
8173  */
8174  u8g_MicroDelay();
8175  u8g_MicroDelay();
8176 }
8177 
8178 
8179 uint32_t i2c_started = 0;
8180 uint32_t i2c_scl_pin = 0;
8181 uint32_t i2c_sda_pin = 0;
8182 void (*i2c_delay)(void) = i2c_100KHz_delay;
8183 
8184 const PinDescription *i2c_scl_pin_desc;
8185 const PinDescription *i2c_sda_pin_desc;
8186 
8187 
8188 /* maybe this can be optimized */
8189 static void i2c_init(void)
8190 {
8191  i2c_sda_pin_desc = &(g_APinDescription[i2c_sda_pin]);
8192  i2c_scl_pin_desc = &(g_APinDescription[i2c_scl_pin]);
8193  pinMode(i2c_sda_pin, OUTPUT);
8194  digitalWrite(i2c_sda_pin, HIGH);
8195  pinMode(i2c_scl_pin, OUTPUT);
8196  digitalWrite(i2c_scl_pin, HIGH);
8197  PIO_Configure( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_OUTPUT_0, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_OPENDRAIN );
8198  PIO_Configure( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_OUTPUT_0, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_OPENDRAIN );
8199  PIO_Clear( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin) ;
8200  PIO_Clear( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin) ;
8201  PIO_Configure( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_INPUT, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_DEFAULT ) ;
8202  PIO_Configure( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_INPUT, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_DEFAULT ) ;
8203  i2c_delay();
8204 }
8205 
8206 /* actually, the scl line is not observed, so this procedure does not return a value */
8207 static void i2c_read_scl_and_delay(void)
8208 {
8209  uint32_t dwMask = i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin;
8210  //PIO_Configure( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_INPUT, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_DEFAULT ) ;
8211  //PIO_SetInput( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_DEFAULT ) ;
8212 
8213  /* set as input */
8214  i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_ODR = dwMask ;
8215  i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_PER = dwMask ;
8216 
8217  i2c_delay();
8218 }
8219 
8220 static void i2c_clear_scl(void)
8221 {
8222  uint32_t dwMask = i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin;
8223 
8224  /* set open collector and drive low */
8225  //PIO_Configure( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_OUTPUT_0, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_OPENDRAIN );
8226  //PIO_SetOutput( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin, 0, 1, 0);
8227 
8228  /* open drain, zero default output */
8229  i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_MDER = dwMask;
8230  i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_CODR = dwMask;
8231  i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_OER = dwMask;
8232  i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_PER = dwMask;
8233 
8234  //PIO_Clear( i2c_scl_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_scl_pin_desc->ulPin) ;
8235 }
8236 
8237 static uint8_t i2c_read_sda(void)
8238 {
8239  uint32_t dwMask = i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin;
8240  //PIO_Configure( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_INPUT, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_DEFAULT ) ;
8241  //PIO_SetInput( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_DEFAULT ) ;
8242 
8243  /* set as input */
8244  i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_ODR = dwMask ;
8245  i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_PER = dwMask ;
8246 
8247 
8248  return 1;
8249 }
8250 
8251 static void i2c_clear_sda(void)
8252 {
8253  uint32_t dwMask = i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin;
8254 
8255  /* set open collector and drive low */
8256  //PIO_Configure( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, PIO_OUTPUT_0, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin, PIO_OPENDRAIN );
8257  //PIO_SetOutput( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin, 0, 1, 0);
8258 
8259  /* open drain, zero default output */
8260  i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_MDER = dwMask ;
8261  i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_CODR = dwMask ;
8262  i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_OER = dwMask ;
8263  i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort->PIO_PER = dwMask ;
8264 
8265  //PIO_Clear( i2c_sda_pin_desc->pPort, i2c_sda_pin_desc->ulPin) ;
8266 }
8267 
8268 static void i2c_start(void)
8269 {
8270  if ( i2c_started != 0 )
8271  {
8272  /* if already started: do restart */
8273  i2c_read_sda(); /* SDA = 1 */
8274  i2c_delay();
8275  i2c_read_scl_and_delay();
8276  }
8277  i2c_read_sda();
8278  /*
8279  if (i2c_read_sda() == 0)
8280  {
8281  // do something because arbitration is lost
8282  }
8283  */
8284  /* send the start condition, both lines go from 1 to 0 */
8285  i2c_clear_sda();
8286  i2c_delay();
8287  i2c_clear_scl();
8288  i2c_started = 1;
8289 }
8290 
8291 
8292 static void i2c_stop(void)
8293 {
8294  /* set SDA to 0 */
8295  i2c_clear_sda();
8296  i2c_delay();
8297 
8298  /* now release all lines */
8299  i2c_read_scl_and_delay();
8300 
8301  /* set SDA to 1 */
8302  i2c_read_sda();
8303  i2c_delay();
8304  i2c_started = 0;
8305 }
8306 
8307 static void i2c_write_bit(uint8_t val)
8308 {
8309  if (val)
8310  i2c_read_sda();
8311  else
8312  i2c_clear_sda();
8313 
8314  i2c_delay();
8315  i2c_read_scl_and_delay();
8316  i2c_clear_scl();
8317 }
8318 
8319 static uint8_t i2c_read_bit(void)
8320 {
8321  uint8_t val;
8322  /* do not drive SDA */
8323  i2c_read_sda();
8324  i2c_delay();
8325  i2c_read_scl_and_delay();
8326  val = i2c_read_sda();
8327  i2c_delay();
8328  i2c_clear_scl();
8329  return val;
8330 }
8331 
8332 static uint8_t i2c_write_byte(uint8_t b)
8333 {
8334  i2c_write_bit(b & 128);
8335  i2c_write_bit(b & 64);
8336  i2c_write_bit(b & 32);
8337  i2c_write_bit(b & 16);
8338  i2c_write_bit(b & 8);
8339  i2c_write_bit(b & 4);
8340  i2c_write_bit(b & 2);
8341  i2c_write_bit(b & 1);
8342 
8343  /* read ack from client */
8344  /* 0: ack was given by client */
8345  /* 1: nothing happend during ack cycle */
8346  return i2c_read_bit();
8347 }
8348 
8349 
8350 
8351 void u8g_i2c_init(uint8_t options)
8352 {
8353  u8g_i2c_opt = options;
8354  u8g_i2c_clear_error();
8355 
8356  if ( u8g_i2c_opt & U8G_I2C_OPT_FAST )
8357  {
8358  i2c_delay = i2c_400KHz_delay;
8359  }
8360  else
8361  {
8362  i2c_delay = i2c_100KHz_delay;
8363  }
8364 
8365 
8366  if ( u8g_i2c_opt & U8G_I2C_OPT_DEV_1 )
8367  {
8368  i2c_scl_pin = PIN_WIRE1_SCL;
8369  i2c_sda_pin = PIN_WIRE1_SDA;
8370 
8371  //REG_PIOA_PDR = PIO_PB12A_TWD1 | PIO_PB13A_TWCK1;
8372  }
8373  else
8374  {
8375 
8376  i2c_scl_pin = PIN_WIRE_SCL;
8377  i2c_sda_pin = PIN_WIRE_SDA;
8378 
8379  //REG_PIOA_PDR = PIO_PA17A_TWD0 | PIO_PA18A_TWCK0;
8380  }
8381 
8382  i2c_init();
8383 
8384 }
8385 
8386 /* sla includes also the r/w bit */
8387 uint8_t u8g_i2c_start(uint8_t sla)
8388 {
8389  i2c_start();
8390  i2c_write_byte(sla);
8391  return 1;
8392 }
8393 
8394 uint8_t u8g_i2c_send_byte(uint8_t data)
8395 {
8396  return i2c_write_byte(data);
8397 }
8398 
8399 void u8g_i2c_stop(void)
8400 {
8401  i2c_stop();
8402 }
8403 
8404 
8405 #elif defined(U8G_RASPBERRY_PI)
8406 
8407 #include <wiringPi.h>
8408 #include <wiringPiI2C.h>
8409 #include <stdio.h>
8410 #include <stdlib.h>
8411 #include <errno.h>
8412 
8413 #define I2C_SLA 0x3c
8414 
8415 static int fd=-1;
8416 static uint8_t i2cMode = 0;
8417 
8418 void u8g_i2c_init(uint8_t options) {
8419  u8g_i2c_clear_error();
8420  u8g_i2c_opt = options;
8421 
8422  if (wiringPiSetup() == -1) {
8423  printf("wiringPi-Error\n");
8424  exit(1);
8425  }
8426 
8427  fd = wiringPiI2CSetup(I2C_SLA);
8428  if (fd < 0) {
8429  printf ("Unable to open I2C device 0: %s\n", strerror (errno)) ;
8430  exit (1) ;
8431  }
8432  //u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_RESET);
8433  //u8g_SetPIOutput(u8g, U8G_PI_A0);
8434 }
8435 uint8_t u8g_i2c_start(uint8_t sla) {
8436  u8g_i2c_send_mode(0);
8437 
8438  return 1;
8439 }
8440 
8441 void u8g_i2c_stop(void) {
8442 }
8443 
8444 uint8_t u8g_i2c_send_mode(uint8_t mode) {
8445  i2cMode = mode;
8446 }
8447 
8448 uint8_t u8g_i2c_send_byte(uint8_t data) {
8449  wiringPiI2CWriteReg8(fd, i2cMode, data);
8450 
8451  return 1;
8452 }
8453 
8454 uint8_t u8g_i2c_wait(uint8_t mask, uint8_t pos)
8455 {
8456  return 1;
8457 }
8458 
8459 #else
8460 
8461 /* empty interface */
8462 
8463 void u8g_i2c_init(uint8_t options)
8464 {
8465  u8g_i2c_clear_error();
8466 }
8467 
8468 uint8_t u8g_i2c_wait(uint8_t mask, uint8_t pos)
8469 {
8470  return 1;
8471 }
8472 
8473 uint8_t u8g_i2c_start(uint8_t sla)
8474 {
8475  return 1;
8476 }
8477 uint8_t u8g_i2c_send_byte(uint8_t data)
8478 {
8479  return 1;
8480 }
8481 
8482 void u8g_i2c_stop(void)
8483 {
8484 }
8485 
8486 
8487 #endif
8488 // ============== u8g_pb8v1.c ===============
8489 
8490 /*
8491 
8492  u8g_pb8v1.c
8493 
8494  8bit height monochrom (1 bit) page buffer
8495  byte has vertical orientation
8496 
8497  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
8498 
8499  Copyright (c) 2011, olikraus@gmail.com
8500  All rights reserved.
8501 
8502  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
8503  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
8504 
8505  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
8506  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
8507 
8508  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
8509  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
8510  materials provided with the distribution.
8511 
8512  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
8513  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
8514  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
8515  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
8516  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
8517  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
8518  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT
8519  NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
8520  LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER
8521  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
8522  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
8523  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
8524  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
8525 
8526 
8527 */
8528 
8529 void u8g_pb8v1_Init(u8g_pb_t *b, void *buf, u8g_uint_t width) U8G_NOINLINE;
8530 void u8g_pb8v1_set_pixel(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t color_index) U8G_NOINLINE;
8531 void u8g_pb8v1_SetPixel(u8g_pb_t *b, const u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t * const arg_pixel) U8G_NOINLINE ;
8532 void u8g_pb8v1_Set8PixelStd(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel) U8G_NOINLINE;
8533 
8534 /* Obsolete, usually set by the init of the structure */
8535 void u8g_pb8v1_Init(u8g_pb_t *b, void *buf, u8g_uint_t width)
8536 {
8537  b->buf = buf;
8538  b->width = width;
8539  u8g_pb_Clear(b);
8540 }
8541 
8542 void u8g_pb8v1_set_pixel(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t x, u8g_uint_t y, uint8_t color_index)
8543 {
8544  register uint8_t mask;
8545  uint8_t *ptr = (uint8_t*)b->buf;
8546 
8547  y -= b->p.page_y0;
8548  mask = 1;
8549  y &= 0x07;
8550  mask <<= y;
8551  ptr += x;
8552  if ( color_index )
8553  {
8554  *ptr |= mask;
8555  }
8556  else
8557  {
8558  mask ^=0xff;
8559  *ptr &= mask;
8560  }
8561 }
8562 
8563 
8564 void u8g_pb8v1_SetPixel(u8g_pb_t *b, const u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t * const arg_pixel)
8565 {
8566  if ( arg_pixel->y < b->p.page_y0 )
8567  return;
8568  if ( arg_pixel->y > b->p.page_y1 )
8569  return;
8570  if ( arg_pixel->x >= b->width )
8571  return;
8572  u8g_pb8v1_set_pixel(b, arg_pixel->x, arg_pixel->y, arg_pixel->color);
8573 }
8574 
8575 void u8g_pb8v1_Set8PixelStd(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel)
8576 {
8577  register uint8_t pixel = arg_pixel->pixel;
8578  do
8579  {
8580  if ( pixel & 128 )
8581  {
8582  u8g_pb8v1_SetPixel(b, arg_pixel);
8583  }
8584  switch( arg_pixel->dir )
8585  {
8586  case 0: arg_pixel->x++; break;
8587  case 1: arg_pixel->y++; break;
8588  case 2: arg_pixel->x--; break;
8589  case 3: arg_pixel->y--; break;
8590  }
8591  pixel <<= 1;
8592  } while( pixel != 0 );
8593 }
8594 
8595 
8596 void u8g_pb8v1_Set8PixelOpt2(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *arg_pixel)
8597 {
8598  register uint8_t pixel = arg_pixel->pixel;
8599  u8g_uint_t dx = 0;
8600  u8g_uint_t dy = 0;
8601 
8602  switch( arg_pixel->dir )
8603  {
8604  case 0: dx++; break;
8605  case 1: dy++; break;
8606  case 2: dx--; break;
8607  case 3: dy--; break;
8608  }
8609 
8610  do
8611  {
8612  if ( pixel & 128 )
8613  u8g_pb8v1_SetPixel(b, arg_pixel);
8614  arg_pixel->x += dx;
8615  arg_pixel->y += dy;
8616  pixel <<= 1;
8617  } while( pixel != 0 );
8618 
8619 }
8620 
8621 uint8_t u8g_dev_pb8v1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg)
8622 {
8623  u8g_pb_t *pb = (u8g_pb_t *)(dev->dev_mem);
8624  switch(msg)
8625  {
8626  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_8PIXEL:
8627  if ( u8g_pb_Is8PixelVisible(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg) )
8628  u8g_pb8v1_Set8PixelOpt2(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg);
8629  break;
8630  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_PIXEL:
8631  u8g_pb8v1_SetPixel(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_pixel_t *)arg);
8632  break;
8633  case U8G_DEV_MSG_INIT:
8634  break;
8635  case U8G_DEV_MSG_STOP:
8636  break;
8637  case U8G_DEV_MSG_PAGE_FIRST:
8638  u8g_pb_Clear(pb);
8639  u8g_page_First(&(pb->p));
8640  break;
8641  case U8G_DEV_MSG_PAGE_NEXT:
8642  if ( u8g_page_Next(&(pb->p)) == 0 )
8643  return 0;
8644  u8g_pb_Clear(pb);
8645  break;
8646 #ifdef U8G_DEV_MSG_IS_BBX_INTERSECTION
8647  case U8G_DEV_MSG_IS_BBX_INTERSECTION:
8648  return u8g_pb_IsIntersection(pb, (u8g_dev_arg_bbx_t *)arg);
8649 #endif
8650  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_PAGE_BOX:
8651  u8g_pb_GetPageBox(pb, (u8g_box_t *)arg);
8652  break;
8653  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_WIDTH:
8654  *((u8g_uint_t *)arg) = pb->width;
8655  break;
8656  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_HEIGHT:
8657  *((u8g_uint_t *)arg) = pb->p.total_height;
8658  break;
8659  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_COLOR_ENTRY:
8660  break;
8661  case U8G_DEV_MSG_SET_XY_CB:
8662  break;
8663  case U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_MODE:
8664  return U8G_MODE_BW;
8665  }
8666  return 1;
8667 }
8668 
8669 
8670 // ============== u8g_pb16v1.c ================
8671

8677  byte has vertical orientation
8678 
8679  Universal 8bit Graphics Library
8680

8682  All rights reserved.
8683 
8684  Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
8685  are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
8686 
8687  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list
8688  of conditions and the following disclaimer.
8689 
8690  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this
8691  list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other
8692  materials provided with the distribution.
8693 
8694  THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND
8695  CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES,
8696  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
8697  MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
8698  DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
8699  CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
8700  SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT

8703  CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
8704  STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
8705  ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF
8706  ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
